translated: you should sustain us too, that is enough.🔽Even though I have seen you, the Self of the universe, who are full of the nectar of supreme bliss,

original: tvayi sparśarase 'tyantatarasutkaṇṭhito / 'smi te // / //
analyzed: tvayi sparśa rase tyantataraḥ utkaṇṭhitaḥ smi te
translated: I am extremely eager for the taste of touch with you.

original: deva duḥkhāny aśeṣāṇi yāni saṃsāriṇām api
analyzed: deva duḥkhāni aśeṣāṇi yāni saṃsāriṇām api
translated: O God, all the sufferings of even those who wander in the world,

original: ghṛtyākhyabhavadīyātmayutāny āyānti sahyatām // / //
analyzed: ghṛti ākhya bhavadīya ātma yutāni āyānti sahyatām
translated: when united with your essence called compassion, become bearable.

original: sarvajñe sarvaśaktau ca tvayy eva sati cinmaye
analyzed: sarvajñe sarva śaktau ca tvayi eva sati cit maye
translated: When you alone exist, O Omniscient One, O All-Powerful One, who are full of consciousness,

original: sarvathāpy asato nātha yuktāsya jagataḥ prathā // / //
analyzed: sarvathā api asataḥ nātha yuktā asya jagataḥ prathā
translated: the manifestation of the world is proper in every way, O Lord, even though it is non-existent.

original: tvatprāṇitāḥ sphurantīme guṇā loṣṭopamā api
analyzed: tvad prāṇitāḥ sphuranti ime guṇāḥ loṣṭa upamāḥ api
translated: These qualities, though resembling a clod, shine when enlivened by you,

original: nṛtyanti pavanoddhūtāḥ kārpāsāḥ picavo yathā // / //
analyzed: nṛtyanti pavana uddhūtāḥ kārpāsāḥ picavaḥ yathā
translated: like cotton balls, blown by the wind, dance about.

original: yadi nātha guṇeṣv ātmābhimāno na bhavet tataḥ
analyzed: yadi nātha guṇeṣu ātma abhimānaḥ na bhavet tatas
translated: If there were no sense of self-identification with the qualities, then

original: kena hīyeta jagatas tvadekātmatayā prathā // / //
analyzed: kena hīyeta jagataḥ tvad eka ātma tayā prathā
translated: by whom would the manifestation of the world as having you as its sole Self be lost?

original: vandyās te 'pi mahīyāṃsaḥ pralayopagatā api
analyzed: vandyāḥ te pi mahīyāṃsaḥ pralaya upagatāḥ api
translated: Even those great ones who have attained dissolution are to be revered,

original: tvatkopapāvakasparśapūtā ye parameśvara // / //
analyzed: tvad kopa pāvaka sparśa pūtāḥ ye parameśvara
translated: O Supreme Lord, those who are purified by the touch of the fire of your anger,

original: mahāprakāśavapuṣi vispaṣṭe bhavati sthite
analyzed: mahā prakāśa vapuṣi vispaṣṭe bhavati sthite
translated: When the body of great light is clearly present,

original: sarvato 'pīśa tat kasmāt tamasi prasarāmy aham // / //
analyzed: sarvatas pi īśa tat kasmāt tamasi prasarāmi aham
translated: O Lord, why do I spread out in darkness from everywhere?

original: avibhāgo bhavān eva svarūpam amṛtaṃ mama
analyzed: avibhāgaḥ bhavān eva sva rūpam amṛtam mama
translated: You are undivided, my immortal nature is your form,

original: tathāpi martyadharmāṇām aham evaikam āspadam // / //
analyzed: tathā api martya dharmāṇām aham evā ekam āspadam
translated: Yet I am the sole refuge of those with mortal qualities.

original: maheśvareti yasyāsti nāmakaṃ vāgvibhūṣaṇam
analyzed: maheśvara iti yasya asti nāmakam vāc vibhūṣaṇam
translated: He who has the ornament of the name Mahesvara on his speech,

original: praṇāmāṅkaś ca śirasi sa evaikaḥ prabhāvitaḥ // / //
analyzed: praṇāma aṅkaḥ ca śirasi saḥ eva ekaḥ prabhāvitaḥ
translated: He alone is honored with a mark of salutation on the head.

original: sadasac ca bhavān eva yena tenāprayāsataḥ
analyzed: sat asat ca bhavān eva yena tena aprayāsataḥ
translated: You are both existent and non-existent, effortlessly,

original: svarasenaiva bhagavaṃs tathā siddhiḥ kathaṃ na me // / //
analyzed: svarasena eva bhagavan tathā siddhiḥ katham na me
translated: O Lord, how is it that I do not attain perfection naturally?

original: śivadāsaḥ śivaikātmā kiṃ yan nāsādayet sukham
translated: What happiness does not a devotee of Shiva, whose sole self is Shiva, attain?

original: tarpyo 'smi devamukhyānām api yenāmṛtāsavaiḥ // / //
analyzed: tarpyaḥ smi deva mukhyānām api yena amṛta āsavaiḥ
translated: By whom I am to be gratified even with the nectar-like essence of the chief gods.

original: hṛnnābhyor antarālasthaḥ prāṇināṃ pittavigrahaḥ
analyzed: hṛd nābhyoḥ antarāla sthaḥ prāṇinām pitta vigrahaḥ
translated: Residing between the heart and navel of living beings in the form of bile,

original: grasase tvaṃ mahāvahniḥ sarvaṃ sthāvarajaṅgamam // / //
analyzed: grasase tvam mahā vahniḥ sarvam sthāvara jaṅgamam
translated: You consume all moving and unmoving things as the great fire.

original: autsukyaviśvasitanāmaikādaśaṃ stotram
analyzed: autsukyaviśvasita nāma ekādaśam stotram
translated: The eleventh hymn named Impatience and Confidence

original: jagad idam athavā suhṛdo bandhujano vā na bhavati mama kim api
analyzed: jagat idam athavā suhṛdaḥ bandhu janaḥ vā na bhavati mama kim api
translated: This world, or my friends and relatives, are nothing to me at all.

original: tvaṃ punar etat sarvaṃ yadā tadā ko 'paro me 'stu // / //
analyzed: tvam punar etat sarvam yadā tadā kaḥ paraḥ me stu
translated: But you are all this, therefore, who else can be mine?

original: svāmin maheśvaras tvaṃ sākṣāt sarvaṃ jagat tvam eveti
analyzed: svāmin maheśvaraḥ tvam sākṣāt sarvam jagat tvam eva iti
translated: O Lord, you are Maheshvara himself, you are the entire universe.

original: vastv eva siddhim etv iti yācñā tatrāpi yācñaiva // / //
analyzed: vastu eva siddhim etu iti yācñā tatra api yācñā eva
translated: May the object itself attain accomplishment - even there, it is only a request.

original: tribhuvanādhipatitvam apīha yat tṛṇam iva pratibhāti bhavajjuṣaḥ
analyzed: tribhuvana adhipati tvam api iha yat tṛṇam iva pratibhāti bhavat juṣaḥ
translated: Even the lordship of the three worlds appears like a straw to one who enjoys (the bliss of) you.

original: kim iva tasya phalaṃ śubhakarmaṇo bhavati nātha bhavatsmaraṇād ṛte // / //
analyzed: kim iva tasya phalam śubha karmaṇaḥ bhavati nātha bhavat smaraṇāt ṛte
translated: O Lord, what can be the fruit of that auspicious action, except the remembrance of you?

original: yena naiva bhavato 'sti vibhinnaṃ kiñcanāpi jagatāṃ prabhavaś ca
analyzed: yena nā eva bhavataḥ sti vibhinnam kiñcana api jagatām prabhavaḥ ca
translated: By whom there is not even the slightest distinction from you, and you are the origin of the worlds,

original: tvadvijṛmbhitam ato 'dbhutakarmasv apy udeti na tava stutibandhaḥ // / //
analyzed: tvad vijṛmbhitam atas dbhuta karmasu api udeti na tava stuti bandhaḥ
translated: Therefore, even in your wonderful deeds, the composition of praise to you does not arise.

original: tvanmayo 'smi bhavadarcananiṣṭhaḥ sarvadāham iti cāpy avirāmam
analyzed: smi bhavat arcana niṣṭhaḥ sarvadā aham iti ca api avirāmam
translated: I am full of you, devoted to worshipping you, and always think I am always yours,

original: bhāvayann api vibho svarasena svapnago 'pi na tathā kim iva syām // / //
analyzed: bhāvayan api vibho svarasena na tathā kim iva syām
translated: Even in a dream, O Lord, how can I be like that, even though I contemplate you naturally?

original: ye manāg api bhavaccaraṇābjodbhūtasaurabhalavena vimṛṣṭaḥ
analyzed: ye manāk api bhavat caraṇa abja udbhūta saurabha lavena vimṛṣṭaḥ
translated: Those who are even slightly touched by the drop of fragrance emanating from your lotus feet,

original: teṣu visram iva bhavati samastaṃ bhogajātam amarair api mṛgyam // / //
analyzed: teṣu visram iva bhavati samastam bhoga jātam amaraiḥ api mṛgyam
translated: In them, all the objects of enjoyment, sought after even by the immortals, are as if relaxed.

original: hṛdi te na tu vidyate 'nyad anyad vacane karmaṇi cānyad eva śaṃbho
analyzed: hṛdi te na tu vidyate anyat vacane karmaṇi ca anyat eva śaṃbho
translated: O Shambhu, in your heart there is one thing, in speech another, and in action yet another.

original: paramārthasato 'py anugraho vā yadi vā nigraha eka eva kāryaḥ // / //
analyzed: paramārtha sataḥ api anugrahaḥ vā yadi vā nigrahaḥ ekaḥ eva kāryaḥ
translated: Of one who truly exists, whether it be grace or punishment, only one should be done.

original: mūḍho 'smi duḥkhakalito 'smi jarādidoṣabhīto 'smi śaktirahito 'smi tavāśrito 'smi
analyzed: mūḍhaḥ smi duḥkha kalitaḥ smi jarā ādi doṣa bhītaḥ smi śakti rahitaḥ smi tava āśritaḥ smi
translated: I am deluded, I am afflicted with sorrow, I am afraid of old age and other faults, I am devoid of power, I am dependent on you.

original: śambho tathā kalaya śīghram upaimi yena sarvottamāṃ dhuram apojjhitaduḥkhamārgaḥ // / //
analyzed: śambho tathā kalaya śīghram upaimi yena sarva uttamām dhuram apojjhita duḥkha mārgaḥ
translated: O Shambhu, act in such a way that I may quickly attain the highest state, abandoning the path of suffering.

original: tvatkarṇadeśama dhiśayya mahārghabhāvam ākranditāni mama tucchatarāṇi yānti
analyzed: tvad karṇa deśam a dhiśayya mahārgha bhāvam ākranditāni mama tucchatarāṇi yānti
translated: Having placed in your ear the extremely valuable sentiments, my lamentations become even more insignificant.

original: vaṃśāntarālapatitāni jalaikadeśakhaṇḍāni mauktikamaṇitvam ivodvahanti // / //
analyzed: vaṃśa antarāla patitāni jala eka deśa khaṇḍāni mauktika maṇi tvam iva udvahanti
translated: They carry themselves like fragments of water fallen between bamboo joints, as if they were pearls and gems.

original: kim iva ca labhyate bata na tair api nātha janaiḥ kṣaṇam api kaitavād api ca ye tava nāmni ratāḥ
analyzed: kim iva ca labhyate bata na taiḥ api nātha janaiḥ kṣaṇam api kaitavāt api ca ye tava nāmni ratāḥ
translated: And what is not obtained by those people, O Lord, who are devoted to your name even for a moment, even playfully?

original: śiśiramayūkhaśekhara tathā kuru yena mama kṣatamaraṇo 'ṇimādikam upaimi yathā vibhavam // / //
analyzed: śiśira mayūkha śekhara tathā kuru yena mama kṣata maraṇaḥ ṇima ādikam upaimi yathā vibhavam
translated: O you who have the moon as your crest-jewel, act in such a way that I may attain the state of being minute and so on, as much as possible, after my death.

original: śambho śarva śaśaṅkaśekhara śiva tryakṣākṣamālādhara śrīmann ugrakapālalāñchana lasadbhīmatriśūlāyudha
analyzed: śambho śarva śaśaṅka śekhara śiva tryakṣa akṣa mālā dhara śrīman ugra kapāla lāñchana lasat bhīma triśūla āyudha
translated: O Shambhu, Sharva, moon-crested one, Shiva, three-eyed one, rosary-holder, glorious one, marked with a fierce skull, with a shining terrible trident weapon,

original: kāruṇyāmbunidhe trilokaracanāśīlograśaktyātmaka śrīkaṇṭhāśu vināśayāśubhabharān ādhat svasiddhiṃ parām // / //
analyzed: kāruṇya ambunidhe triloka racanā śīla ugra śakti ātmaka śrīkaṇṭha āśu vināśaya aśubha bharān ādhat sva siddhim parām
translated: O ocean of compassion, having the nature of the fierce power that creates the three worlds, O Shiva, quickly destroy the mass of inauspiciousness and bestow your supreme accomplishment.

original: tat kiṃ nātha bhaven na yatra bhagavān nirmātṛtām aśnute bhāvaḥ syāt kim u tasya cetanavato nāśāsti yaṃ śaṅkaraḥ
analyzed: tat kim nātha bhavet na yatra bhagavān nirmātṛ tām aśnute bhāvaḥ syāt kim tasya cetanavataḥ na āśā asti yam śaṅkaraḥ
translated: What is that, O Lord, where the Blessed One does not attain the state of creation? What is that state of the conscious one which does not perish, which is protected by Shankara?

original: itthaṃ te parameśvarākṣatamahāśakteḥ sadā saṃśritaḥ saṃsāre 'tra nirantarādhividhuraḥ kliśyāmy ahaṃ kevalam // / //
analyzed: ittham te parameśvara akṣata mahā śakteḥ sadā saṃśritaḥ saṃsāre nirantara ādhi vidhuraḥ kliśyāmi aham kevalam
translated: Thus, I who am always devoted to the great power of the Supreme Lord, suffer only in this world, full of continuous troubles.

original: yady apy atra varapradoddhatatamāḥ pīḍājarāmṛtyava ete vā kṣaṇam āsatāṃ bahumataḥ śabdādir evāsthiraḥ
analyzed: yadi api atra vara prada uddhatatamāḥ pīḍā jarā mṛtyavaḥ ete vā kṣaṇam āsatām bahu mataḥ śabda ādiḥ evā asthiraḥ
translated: Even if these most powerful bestowers of boons, suffering, old age, and death, or these [senses], remain for a moment, the much-valued sound and so on are indeed impermanent.

original: tatrāpi spṛhayāmi santatasukhākāṅkṣī ciraṃ sthāsnave bhogāsvādayutatvadaṅghrikamaladhyānāgrya jīvātave // / //
analyzed: tatra api spṛhayāmi santata sukha ākāṅkṣī ciram sthāsnave bhoga āsvāda yuta tvad aṅghri kamala dhyāna agrya jīvātave
translated: Even there, I long to remain for a long time, desiring continuous happiness, to live by the foremost meditation on Your lotus feet, which is accompanied by the taste of enjoyment.

original: he nātha praṇatārtināśanapaṭo śreyonidhe dhūrjaṭe duḥkhaikāyatanasya janmamaraṇatrastasya me sāmpratam
analyzed: he nātha praṇata ārti nāśana paṭo śreyaḥ nidhe dhūrjaṭe duḥkha eka āyatanasya janma maraṇa trastasya me sāmpratam
translated: O Lord, O destroyer of the distress of those who bow down, O treasure of welfare, O Dhūrjaṭi, for me who am now the sole abode of suffering, frightened by birth and death,

original: tac ceṣṭasva yathā manojñaviṣayāsvādapradā uttamā jīvann eva samaśnuve 'ham acalāḥ siddhīs tvadarcāparaḥ // / //
analyzed: tat ceṣṭasva yathā manojña viṣaya āsvāda pradāḥ uttamāḥ jīvan eva samaśnuve ham acalāḥ siddhīḥ tvad arcā paraḥ
translated: Do that by which, while living, I may enjoy the highest, which bestows the taste of delightful objects, solely devoted to worshipping You, O Lord, may I attain the unshakable perfections.

original: namo mohamahādhvāntadhvaṃsanānanyakarmaṇe
analyzed: namaḥ moha mahā dhvānta dhvaṃsana ananya karmaṇe
translated: Salutations to the one whose sole action is the destruction of the great darkness of delusion,

original: sarvaprakāśātiśayaprakāśāyendulakṣmaṇe // / //
analyzed: sarva prakāśa atiśaya prakāśāya indu lakṣmaṇe
translated: To the one with a moon-mark, the light of all the most radiant lights.

original: rahasyanirdeśanāma dvādaśaṃ stotram
analyzed: rahasyanirdeśa nāma dvādaśam stotram
translated: The twelfth hymn named The Secret Instruction

original: sahakāri na kiñcid iṣyate bhavato na pratibandhakaṃ dṛṣi
analyzed: sahakāri na kiñcid iṣyate bhavataḥ na pratibandhakam
translated: Nothing is considered to be a cooperative cause for You, nor an obstruction in seeing.

original: bhavataiva hi sarvam āplutaṃ katham adyāpi tathāpi nekṣase // / //
analyzed: bhavatā eva hi sarvam āplutam katham adyā api tathā api nā īkṣase
translated: Indeed, everything is pervaded by You alone. Why do You not see it even now?

original: api bhāvagaṇād apīndriyapracayād apy avabodhamadhyataḥ
analyzed: api bhāva gaṇāt api indriya pracayāt api avabodha madhyataḥ
translated: Even though it arises from the collection of entities, from the multitude of senses, and even from the middle of understanding,

original: prabhavantam api svataḥ sadā paripaśyeyam apoḍhaviśvakam // / //
analyzed: prabhavantam api svatas sadā paripaśyeyam apoḍha viśvakam
translated: I may always see it as self-arisen, devoid of the entire universe.

original: kathaṃ te jāyeran katham api ca te darśanapathaṃ vrajeyuḥ kenāpi prakṛtimahatāṅkena khacitaḥ 🔽tathotthāyotthāya sthalajalatṛṇāder akhilataḥ padārthadyānsṛṣṭisravadamṛtapūrair /
analyzed: katham te jāyeran katham api ca te darśana patham vrajeyuḥ kena api prakṛti mahatā aṅkena khacitaḥ  tathā utthāya utthāya sthala jala tṛṇa ādeḥ akhilatas padārtha dyān sṛṣṭi sravat amṛta pūraiḥ
translated: How could they be born and how could they come within the range of your vision? By some great natural merit,🔽Thus rising up again and again, you scatter all the objects of land, water, grass, etc.

original: vikirasi // / //🔽sākṣatkṛta bhavadrūpaprasṛtāmṛtatarpitāḥ
analyzed: vikirasi  sākṣatkṛta bhavat rūpa prasṛta amṛta tarpitāḥ
translated: With the nectar-filled creations flowing from you.🔽The desires of those whose thirst has been uprooted by the nectar flowing from the form of yours that has been directly realized

original: unmūlitatṛṣo mattā vicaranti yathāruci // / //
analyzed: unmūlita tṛṣaḥ mattāḥ vicaranti yathāruci
translated: Roam as they please, intoxicated.

original: na tadā na sadā na caikadety api sā yatra na kāladhīr bhavet
analyzed: na tadā na sadā na ca ekadā iti api sā yatra na kāla dhīḥ bhavet
translated: Where there is no notion of time - not then, not always, and not even at one time -

original: tad idaṃ bhavadīyadarśanaṃ na ca nityaṃ na ca kathyate 'nyathā // / //
analyzed: tat idam bhavadīya darśanam na ca nityam na ca kathyate nyathā
translated: That vision of yours is not eternal, nor is it said otherwise.

original: tvadvilokanasamutkacetaso yogasiddhir iyatī sadāstu me
analyzed: tvad vilokana samutka cetasaḥ yoga siddhiḥ iyatī sadā astu me
translated: May this much of the attainment of yoga always be mine, whose mind is eager to see you,

original: yad viśeyam abhisandhimātratas tvatsudhāsadanam arcanāya te // / //🔽nirvikalpabhavadīyadarśanapraptiphullamanasāṃ mahātmanām
analyzed: yat viśeyam abhisandhi mātrataḥ tvad sudhā sadanam arcanāya te  nirvikalpa bhavadīya darśana prapti phulla manasām mahātmanām
translated: So that I may enter your nectar-filled abode merely by the power of concentration to worship you.🔽The pure and clear actions and words of the great souls whose minds are blossomed by attaining the vision of yours free from conceptualization

original: ullasanti vimalāni helayā ceṣṭitāni ca vacāṃsi ca sphuṭam // / //
analyzed: ullasanti vimalāni helayā ceṣṭitāni ca vacāṃsi ca sphuṭam
translated: Clearly shine forth with ease.

original: bhavanbhavadīyapādayor nivasann antara eva nirbhayaḥ
analyzed: bhavan bhavadīya pādayoḥ nivasan antare eva nirbhayaḥ
translated: Dwelling fearlessly within you and your feet,

original: bhavabhūmiṣu tāsu tāsv ahaṃ prabhum arceyam anargalakriyaḥ // / //🔽bhavadaṅghrisaroruhodare parilīno galitaparaiṣaṇaḥ
analyzed: bhava bhūmiṣu tāsu tāsu aham prabhum arceyam anargala kriyaḥ  bhavat aṅghri saroruha udare parilīnaḥ galita para eṣaṇaḥ
translated: In those and those stages of existence, I, free from obstacles, should worship the Lord.🔽Having merged in the interior of Your lotus feet, with all external desires dissolved,

original: atimātramadhūpayogataḥ paritṛpto vicareyam icchayā // / //
analyzed: atimātra madhu upayogataḥ paritṛptaḥ vicareyam icchayā
translated: Fully satisfied by the extremely sweet nectar, I should move about as I please.

original: yasya dambhād iva bhavatpūjāsaṅkalpa utthitaḥ
analyzed: yasya dambhāt iva bhavat pūjā saṅkalpaḥ utthitaḥ
translated: For him, from whom the resolve to worship You has arisen as if out of pride,

original: tasyāpy avaśyam uditaṃ sannidhānaṃ tavocitam // / //
analyzed: tasya api avaśyam uditam sannidhānam tava ucitam
translated: For him too, the manifestation of Your presence is certainly appropriate.

original: bhagavann itarān apekṣiṇā nitarām ekarasena cetasā
analyzed: bhagavan itarān apekṣiṇā nitarām ekarasena cetasā
translated: O Lord, with a mind that is completely one-pointed and free from dependence on others,

original: sulabhaṃ sakalopaśāyinaṃ prabhum ātṛpti pibeyam asmi kim // / //
analyzed: sulabham sakala upaśāyinam prabhum ātṛpti pibeyam asmi kim
translated: I should drink to my heart's content the easily accessible Lord who is the abode of all.

original: tvayā nirākṛtam sarvaṃ heyam etat tad eva tu
analyzed: tvayā nirākṛtam sarvam heyam etat tat eva tu
translated: O Lord, all this that is to be rejected has been discarded by You, and that alone

original: tvanmayaṃ samupādeyam ity ayaṃ sārasaṃgrahaḥ // / //
analyzed: tvad mayam samupādeyam iti ayam sāra saṃgrahaḥ
translated: Which is to be accepted as consisting of You - this is the essence of the summary.

original: bhavato 'ntaracāri bhāvajātaṃ prabhuvanmukhyatayaiva pūjitaṃ tat
analyzed: bhavataḥ ntara cāri bhāva jātam prabhu vat mukhya tayā eva pūjitam tat
translated: The group of entities moving within You is worshipped primarily as the Lord Himself,

original: bhavato bahir apy abhāvamātrā katham īśān bhavet samarcyate vā // / //
analyzed: bhavataḥ bahis api abhāva mātrā katham īśān bhavet samarcyate vā
translated: How can that which is mere non-existence even externally be worshipped as the Lord?

original: niḥśabdaṃ nirvikalpaṃ ca nirvyākṣepam athānisam
analyzed: niḥśabdam nirvikalpam ca nirvyākṣepam atha anisam
translated: Soundless, free from conceptualization, without distraction, and without support,

original: kṣobhe 'py adhyakṣamī kṣeyaṃ tryakṣa tvām eva sarvataḥ // / //
analyzed: kṣobhe pi kṣeyam tryakṣa tvām eva sarvatas
translated: Even in agitation, you are to be worshipped, O three-eyed one, I bow to you alone in every way.

original: prakaṭaya nijadhāma deva yasmiṃs tvam asi sadā parameśvarīsametaḥ
analyzed: prakaṭaya nija dhāma deva yasmin tvam asi sadā parameśvarī sametaḥ
translated: O Lord, reveal your abode where you always dwell together with the Supreme Goddess,

original: prabhucaraṇarajaḥsamānakakṣyāḥ kim aviśvāsapadaṃ bhānti bhṛtyāḥ // / //
analyzed: prabhu caraṇa rajaḥ samāna kakṣyāḥ kim aviśvāsa padam bhānti bhṛtyāḥ
translated: Are the servants shining in a position of disbelief, equal in rank to the dust of the feet of the Lord?

original: darśanapatham upayāto 'py apasarasi kuto mameśa bhṛtyasya
analyzed: darśana patham upayātaḥ pi apasarasi kutas mama īśa bhṛtyasya
translated: O Lord, even though you have come within the range of my sight, why do you flee?

original: kṣaṇamātrakam iha na bhavasi kasya na jantor dṛśor viṣayaḥ // / //🔽aikyasaṃvidamṛtācchadhārayā santataprasṛtayā kadā vibho
analyzed: kṣaṇa mātrakam iha na bhavasi kasya na jantoḥ dṛśoḥ viṣayaḥ  aikya saṃvid amṛta accha dhārayā santata prasṛtayā kadā vibho
translated: For a mere moment, you are not the object of the eyes of any being here.🔽O Lord, when will I, by the continuous flow of the nectar-like essence of the consciousness of oneness,

original: plāvanāt paramabhedamānayaṃs tvāṃ nijaṃ ca vapur āpnuyāṃ mudam // / //
analyzed: plāvanāt parama bhedam ānayan tvām nijam ca vapuḥ āpnuyām mudam
translated: By the submergence of all distinctions, attain you and my own body and joy?

original: aham ity amuto 'varuddhalokād bhavadīyāt pratipattisārato me
analyzed: aham iti amutas varuddha lokāt bhavadīyāt pratipatti sārataḥ me
translated: From that world of I which is yours, which is the essence of realization,

original: aṇumātrakam eva viśvaniṣṭhaṃ ghaṭatāṃ yena bhaveyam arcitā te // / //
analyzed: aṇu mātrakam eva viśva niṣṭham ghaṭatām yena bhaveyam arcitā te
translated: May I become one who has worshipped you, which is the limit of the universe, even to the smallest atom.

original: aparimitarūpam ahaṃ taṃ taṃ bhāvaṃ pratikṣaṇaṃ paśyan
analyzed: aparimita rūpam aham tam tam bhāvam pratikṣaṇam paśyan
translated: Seeing that one in various forms every moment, I

original: tvām eva viśvarūpaṃ nijanāthaṃ sādhu paśyeyam // / //
analyzed: tvām eva viśvarūpam nija nātham sādhu paśyeyam
translated: May I see you alone, O my Lord, in the form of the universe.

original: bhavadaṅgagataṃ tam eva kasmān na manaḥ paryaṭatīṣṭam artham artham
analyzed: bhavat aṅga gatam tam eva kasmāt na manaḥ paryaṭati iṣṭam artham artham
translated: Why does the mind not wander to that very object of desire which is present in your body?

original: prakṛtikṣatir asti no tathāsya mama cecchā paripūryate paraiva // / //
analyzed: prakṛti kṣatiḥ asti no tathā asya mama ca icchā paripūryate parā eva
translated: There is no harm to its nature, and my desire is fulfilled by itself.

original: śataśaḥ kila te tavānubhāvād bhagavan ke 'py amunaiva cakṣuṣā ye
analyzed: śataśas kila te tava anubhāvāt bhagavan ke pi amunā eva cakṣuṣā ye
translated: It is said that hundreds of people, by your power, O Lord, with this very eye,

original: api hālikaceṣṭayā carantaḥ paripaśyanti bhavadvapuḥ sadāgre // / //
analyzed: api hālika ceṣṭayā carantaḥ paripaśyanti bhavat vapuḥ sadā agre
translated: Even those who move about with the behavior of farmers, always see your form in front.

original: na sā matir udeti yā na bhavati tvadicchāmayī sadā śubham athetarad bhagavataivam ācaryate
analyzed: na sā matiḥ udeti yā na bhavati tvad icchā mayī sadā śubham athā itarat bhagavatā evam ācaryate
translated: That thought does not arise which is not always full of your will, good or otherwise, O Lord, is taught by you alone.

original: ato 'smi bhavadātmako bhuvi yathā tathā sañcaran sthi to 'niśam abādhitatvadamalaṅghripūjotsavaḥ // / //
analyzed: atas smi bhavat ātmakaḥ bhuvi yathā tathā sañcaran sthi niśam abādhita tvad dama laṅghri pūjā utsavaḥ
translated: Therefore, I, being of your nature, wandering on the earth in some way or other, am always established, with the uninterrupted festival of worship of your pure feet.

original: bhavadīyagabhīrabhāṣiteṣu pratibhā samyag udetu me puro 'taḥ
analyzed: bhavadīya gabhīra bhāṣiteṣu pratibhā samyak udetu me puras tas
translated: May the power to understand properly arise in me in front of your profound statements.

original: tadanuṣṭhitaśaktir apy atas tadbhavadarcāvyasanaṃ ca nirvirāmam // / //
analyzed: tad anuṣṭhita śaktiḥ api atas tad bhavat arcā vyasanam ca nirvirāmam
translated: Even though I have accomplished that power, may my addiction to worshipping you be uninterrupted.

original: vyavahārapade 'pi sarvadā pratibhātv arthakalāpa eṣa mām
analyzed: vyavahāra pade sarvadā pratibhātu artha kalāpaḥ eṣa mām
translated: Even on the level of worldly conduct, may this group of meanings always appear to me.

original: bhavato 'vayavo yathā na tu svata evādaraṇīyatāṃ gataḥ // / //
analyzed: bhavataḥ vayavaḥ yathā na tu svatas evā ādaraṇīya tām gataḥ
translated: You are a part of Him, but not by yourself have you attained the state of being worthy of being taken up.

original: manasi svarasena yatra tatra pracaraty apy aham asya gocareṣu
analyzed: manasi sva rasena yatra tatra pracarati api aham asya gocareṣu
translated: Wherever my mind naturally moves, even there,

original: prasṛto 'py avilola eva yuṣmatparicaryācaturaḥ sadā bhaveyam // / //
analyzed: prasṛtaḥ api avilolaḥ eva yuṣmad paricaryā caturaḥ sadā bhaveyam
translated: I may be engaged in your objects, yet always be skilled in serving you, without wavering.

original: bhagavan bhavadicchayaiva dāsas tava jāto 'smi parasya nātra śaktiḥ
analyzed: bhagavan bhavat icchayā eva dāsaḥ tava smi parasya na atra śaktiḥ
translated: O Lord, by your will alone I have become your servant, not by my own power.

original: katham eṣa tathāpi vaktrabimbaṃ tava paśyāmi na jātu citram etat // / //
analyzed: katham eṣa tathā api vaktra bimbam tava paśyāmi na jātu citram etat
translated: How is it that I never see your face? This is not surprising at all.

original: samutsukās tvāṃ prati ye bhavantaṃ pratyartharūpād avalokayanti
analyzed: samutsukāḥ tvām prati ye bhavantam prati artha rūpāt avalokayanti
translated: Those who are eager for you and look at you as the form of the enemy,

original: teṣām aho kiṃ tadupasthitaṃ syāt kiṃ sādhanaṃ vā phalitaṃ bhavet tat // / //
analyzed: teṣām aho kim tat upasthitam syāt kim sādhanam vā phalitam bhavet tat
translated: what could be the cause of their presence? What could be the result of their practice?

original: bhāvā bhāvatayā santu bhavadbhāvena me bhava
analyzed: bhāvāḥ bhāva tayā santu bhavat bhāvena me bhava
translated: Let things be as they are in reality, let me be as you are in reality.

original: tathā na kiñcid apy astu na kiñcid bhavato 'nyathā // / //
analyzed: tathā na kiñcid api astu na kiñcid bhavataḥ nyathā
translated: Let nothing be at all, nothing be otherwise than nothing.

original: yan na kiñcid api tanna kiñcid apy astu kiñcid api kiñcid eva me
analyzed: yat na kiñcid api tat na kiñcid api astu kiñcid api kiñcid eva me
translated: Let what is nothing be nothing, let what is something be something for me.

original: sarvathā bhavatu tāvatā bhavān sarvato bhavati labdhapūjitaḥ // / //
analyzed: sarvathā bhavatu tāvatā bhavān sarvatas bhavati labdha pūjitaḥ
translated: In every way, let it be so. You are worshipped everywhere by me.

original: saṃgrahastotranāma trayodaśaṃ stotram
analyzed: saṃgraha stotra nāma trayodaśam stotram
translated: The Thirteenth Hymn Named Sangraha Stotra

original: saṃgrahena sukhaduḥkhalakṣaṇaṃ māṃ prati sthitam idaṃ śṛṇu prabho
analyzed: saṃgrahena sukha duḥkha lakṣaṇam mām prati sthitam idam śṛṇu prabho
translated: O Lord, listen to this, which is established before me, the characteristic of happiness and sorrow through Sangraha:

original: saukhyam eṣa bhavatā samāgamaḥ svāminā viraha eva duḥkhitā // / //
analyzed: saukhyam eṣa bhavatā samāgamaḥ svāminā virahaḥ eva duḥkhitā
translated: This is happiness - your association. Separation from the Lord is indeed sorrow.

original: antar apy atitarām aṇīyasī yā tvadaprathanakālikāsti me
analyzed: antar api atitarām aṇīyasī yā tvad a prathana kālikā asti me
translated: Even within, there is a very small amount of time when your fame does not exist for me.

original: tām apīśa parimṛjya sarvataḥ svaṃ svarūpam amalaṃ prakāśaya // / //
analyzed: tām api īśa parimṛjya sarvatas svam sva rūpam amalam prakāśaya
translated: O Lord, having wiped that away completely, manifest your own pure form.

original: tāvake vapuṣi viśvanirbhare citsudhārasamaye niratyaye
analyzed: tāvake vapuṣi viśva nirbhare cit sudhā rasa maye niratyaye
translated: In your body, which is filled with the universe, which is the nectar of consciousness, which is infallible,

original: tiṣṭhataḥ satatam arcataḥ prabhuṃ jīvitaṃ mṛtam athānyad astu me // / //🔽īśvaro 'ham aham eva rūpavān paṇḍito 'smi subhago 'smi ko 'paraḥ
analyzed: tiṣṭhataḥ satatam arcataḥ prabhum jīvitam mṛtam atha anyat astu me  īśvaraḥ ham aham eva rūpavān paṇḍitaḥ smi subhagaḥ smi kaḥ paraḥ
translated: I always remain, worshipping the Lord. Let my life be dead, or let there be something else.

original: matsamo 'sti jagatīti śobhate mānitā tvadanurāgiṇaḥ param // / //
analyzed: mad samaḥ sti jagatī iti śobhate māni tā tvad anurāgiṇaḥ param
translated: I am God, I alone am handsome, I am wise, I am fortunate, who else?  There is no one equal to me in the world. This shines forth, O Supreme One, of those who are devoted to you.

original: devadeva bhavadadvayāmṛtākhyātisaṃharaṇalabdhajanmanā
analyzed: devadeva bhavat advaya amṛta akhyāti saṃharaṇa labdha janmanā
translated: O God of gods, I have obtained birth through the removal of the fame of your non-dual nectar,

original: tad yathāsthitapadārthasaṃvidā māṃ kuruṣva caraṇārcanocitam // / //
analyzed: tat yathā sthita padārtha saṃvidā mām kuruṣva caraṇa arcana ucitam
translated: By the knowledge of things as they are, make me worthy of worshipping your feet.

original: dhyāyate tad anu dṛśyate tataḥ spṛśyate ca parameśvaraḥ svayam
analyzed: dhyāyate tat anu dṛśyate tatas spṛśyate ca parameśvaraḥ svayam
translated: After meditating, the Supreme Lord is seen and then touched.

original: yatra pūjanamahotsavaḥ sa me sarvadāstu bhavato 'nubhāvataḥ // / //
analyzed: yatra pūjana mahā utsavaḥ sa me sarvadā astu bhavataḥ nubhāvataḥ
translated: May that worship and great festival always be for me, by your grace.

original: yady athāsthitapadārthadarśanaṃ yuṣmadarcanamahotsavaś ca yaḥ
analyzed: yadi atha āsthita padārtha darśanam yuṣmad arcana mahā utsavaḥ ca yaḥ
translated: If the vision of things as they are and the great festival of worshipping you

original: yugmam etad itaretarāśrayaṃ bhaktiśāliṣu sadā vijṛmbhate // / //
analyzed: yugmam etat itaretara āśrayam bhakti śāliṣu sadā vijṛmbhate
translated: are mutually dependent, they always manifest for the devoted.

original: tattadindriyamukhena santataṃ yuṣmadarcanarasāyanāsavam
analyzed: tad tad indriya mukhena santatam yuṣmad arcana rasāyana āsavam
translated: Through each sense organ, continuously drinking the nectar of worshipping you,

original: sarvabhāvacaṣakeṣu pūriteṣv āpibann api bhaveyam unmadaḥ // / //
analyzed: sarva bhāva caṣakeṣu pūriteṣu āpiban api bhaveyam unmadaḥ
translated: may I be intoxicated, filling the cups of all beings.

original: anyavedyam aṇumātram asti na svaprakāśam akhilaṃ vijṛmbhate
analyzed: anya vedyam aṇu mātram asti na sva prakāśam akhilam vijṛmbhate
translated: There is not even an atom of anything else to be known; everything shines forth in self-luminous consciousness.

original: yatra nātha bhavataḥ pure sthitaṃ tatra me kuru sadā tavārcituḥ // / //
analyzed: yatra nātha bhavataḥ pure sthitam tatra me kuru sadā tava arcituḥ
translated: O Lord, may I always be engaged in worshipping you there, in your city.

original: dāsadhāmni viniyojito 'py ahaṃ svecchayaiva parameśvara tvayā
analyzed: dāsa dhāmni viniyojitaḥ aham sva icchayā eva parameśvara tvayā
translated: Though employed in the abode of a servant, I am by you, O Supreme Lord, as if by my own will.

original: darśanena na kim asmi pātritaḥ pādasaṃvahanakarmaṇāpi vā // / //
analyzed: darśanena na kim asmi pātritaḥ pāda saṃvahana karmaṇā api vā
translated: Am I not worthy of being seen, or even of the service of washing your feet?

original: śaktipātasamaye vicāraṇaṃ prāptam īśa na karoṣi karhicit
analyzed: śaktipāta samaye vicāraṇam prāptam īśa na karoṣi karhicit
translated: O Lord, at the time of the descent of grace, you never engage in deliberation,

original: adya māṃ prati kim āgataṃ yataḥ svaprakāśanavidhau vilambase // / //
analyzed: adya mām prati kim āgatam yatas sva prakāśana vidhau vilambase
translated: What has happened to me today that you delay in the process of self-manifestation?

original: tatra tatra viṣaye bahirvibhāty antare ca parameśvarīyutam
analyzed: tatra tatra viṣaye bahis vibhāti antare ca parameśvarī yutam
translated: In that and that object, you appear externally, and internally united with the Supreme Goddess,

original: tvāṃ jagattritayanirbharaṃ sadā lokayeya nijapāṇipūjitam // / //🔽svāmisaudham abhisandhimātrato nirvibandham adhiruhya sarvadā
analyzed: tvām jagat tritaya nirbharam sadā lokayeya nija pāṇi pūjitam  svāmi saudham abhisandhi mātrataḥ nirvibandham adhiruhya sarvadā
translated: I would always behold you, filled with the three worlds, worshipped with my own hands.🔽Having ascended the palace of the Lord without any hindrance merely by the power of concentration,

original: syāṃ prasāda paramāmṛtāsavāpānakeliparilabdhanirvṛtiḥ // / //🔽yatsamastasubhagārthavastuṣu sparśamātravidhinā camatkṛtim
analyzed: syām prasāda parama amṛta āsava āpāna keli parilabdha nirvṛtiḥ  yat samasta subhaga artha vastuṣu sparśa mātra vidhinā camatkṛtim
translated: I would always attain fulfillment by engaging in the sport of drinking the nectar of supreme grace.

original: tāṃ samarpayati tena te vapuḥ pūjayanty acalabhaktiśālinaḥ // / //
analyzed: tām samarpayati tena te vapuḥ pūjayanti acala bhakti śālinaḥ
translated: Those who possess unwavering devotion offer their bodies to you, as it bestows delight merely by the touch of all beautiful objects.

original: sphārayasy akhilam ātmanā sphuran viśvam āmṛśasi rūpam āmṛśan
analyzed: sphārayasi akhilam ātmanā sphuran viśvam āmṛśasi rūpam āmṛśan
translated: Shining forth with your own essence, you pervade the entire universe, experiencing the form of the universe.

original: yat svayaṃ nijarasena ghurṇase tat samullasati bhāvamaṇḍalam // / //
