original: jyotir asti kathayāpi na kiṃ cid viśvam apy atisuṣuptam aśeṣam
analyzed: jyotiḥ asti kathayā api na kim cit viśvam api ati suṣuptam aśeṣam
translated: Is there not even a little light in the world, which is in deep sleep,

original: yatra nātha śivarātripade 'smin nityam arcayati bhaktajanas tvām // / //
analyzed: yatra nātha śivarātri pade smin nityam arcayati bhakta janaḥ tvām
translated: Where, O Lord, the devotees always worship you on the day of Shiva's night?

original: sattvaṃ satyaguṇe śive bhagavati sphārībhavatv arcane cūḍāyāṃ vilasantu śaṅkarapadaprodyadrajaḥsaṅcayāḥ
analyzed: sattvam satya guṇe śive bhagavati sphārībhavatu arcane cūḍāyām vilasantu śaṅkara pada prodyat rajaḥ saṅcayāḥ
translated: May the sattva quality increase in the worship of the auspicious Goddess, who has the quality of truth. May the dust particles from the word Shankara shine on the crown.

original: rāgādismṛtivāsanām api samucchettuṃ tamo jṛmbhatāṃ śambho me bhavatāt tvadātmavilaye traiguṇyavargo 'thavā // / //
analyzed: rāga ādi smṛti vāsanām api samucchettum tamaḥ jṛmbhatām śambho me bhavatāt tvad ātma vilaye
translated: May the darkness yawn to cut off even the impressions of memory like attachment. May Shiva be for me, or may the group of three qualities dissolve into you.

original: saṃsārādhvā sudūraḥ kharataravividhavyādhidagdhāṅgayaṣṭiḥ bhogā naivopabhuktā yad api sukham abhūj jātu nanno cirāya
analyzed: saṃsāra adhvā su dūraḥ kharatara vividha vyādhi dagdha aṅgayaṣṭiḥ bhogāḥ nā evā upabhuktāḥ yat api sukham abhūt jātu nan no cirāya
translated: The path of worldly existence is very long, my body is scorched by various severe diseases, although I have never enjoyed pleasures, I have never experienced happiness for a long time.

original: itthaṃ vyartho 'smi jātaḥ śaśidharacaraṇākrāntikāntottamāṅgas tvadbhaktaś ceti tan me kuru sapadi mahāsampado dīrghadīrghāḥ // /
analyzed: ittham smi jātaḥ śaśidhara caraṇa ākrānti kānta uttamāṅgaḥ tvad bhaktaḥ ca iti tat me kuru sapadi mahā sampadaḥ dīrgha dīrghāḥ
translated: Thus, I am born in vain, my head is touched by the feet of the moon-holder, and I am your devotee. Therefore, O great one, grant me long and long great riches.

original: pāśānudbhedanāma ṣoḍaśaṃ stotram
analyzed: pāśānudbheda nāma ṣoḍaśam stotram
translated: The sixteenth hymn named Breaking the Nooses

original: na kiñcid eva lokānāṃ bhavadāvaraṇaṃ prati varyat kiṃ cid eva bhūtānāṃem cit Naresvaraparīksā
analyzed: na kiñcid eva lokānām bhavat āvaraṇam prati kim cit eva
translated: There is nothing at all that obstructs people from you. There is nothing at all that obstructs beings from you, O Lord of Men.

original: na kiñcid eva bhaktānāṃ bhavadāvaraṇaṃ prati // / //
analyzed: na kiñcid eva bhaktānām bhavat āvaraṇam prati
translated: There is nothing at all that obstructs devotees from you.

original: apy upāyakramaprāpyaḥ saṅkulo 'pi viśeṣaṇaiḥ
analyzed: api upāya krama prāpyaḥ viśeṣaṇaiḥ
translated: Even though you are to be attained through a sequence of means, even though you are crowded with distinctions,

original: bhaktibhājāṃ bhavān ātmā sakṛc chuddho 'vabhāsate // / //
analyzed: bhakti bhājām bhavān ātmā sakṛt śuddhaḥ vabhāsate
translated: You appear to those who have devotion, pure and single, as the Self.

original: jayanto 'pi hasanty ete jitā api hasanti ca
analyzed: jayantaḥ u pi hasanti ete jitāḥ api hasanti ca
translated: Even those who are victorious laugh, and even those who are defeated laugh.

original: bhavadbhaktisudhāpānamattāḥ ke 'py eva ye prabho // / //
analyzed: bhavat bhakti sudhā pāna mattāḥ ke pi eva ye prabho
translated: O Lord, there are some who are intoxicated by drinking the nectar of devotion to you.

original: śuṣkakaṃ maiva siddheya maiva mucyeya vāpi tu
analyzed: śuṣkakam mā eva mā eva mucyeya vā api tu
translated: May I not be dried up, may I not be liberated,

original: svādiṣṭhaparakāṣṭāptatvadbhaktirasanirbharaḥ // / //
translated: Filled with the essence of devotion to you, O most sweet and supreme one.

original: yathaivajñātapūrvo 'yaṃ bhavadbhaktiraso mama
analyzed: yathā eva jñāta pūrvaḥ yam bhavat bhakti rasaḥ mama
translated: Just as this essence of devotion to you was known by me before,

original: ghaṭitas tadvad īśāna sa eva paripuṣyatu // / //
analyzed: ghaṭitaḥ tadvat īśāna saḥ eva paripuṣyatu
translated: O Lord, may that very same essence be fulfilled by you.

original: satyena bhagavan nānyaḥ prārthanāprasaro 'sti me 🔽kevalaṃ sa tathā ko 'pi bhaktyāveśo 'stu me sadā // / //
analyzed: satyena bhagavat nā anyaḥ prārthanā prasaraḥ sti me  kevalam sa tathā kaḥ pi bhakti āveśaḥ astu me sadā
translated: O Lord, there is no other request to make except the truth.🔽May I always have that kind of devotion-filled absorption.

original: bhaktikṣīvo 'pi kupyeyaṃ bhavāyānuśayīya ca
analyzed: bhaktikṣīvaḥ pi kupyeyam bhavāya anuśayīya ca
translated: Even being intoxicated with devotion, I may become angry for the sake of attachment,

original: tathā haseyaṃ udyāṃ ca raṭeyaṃ ca śivety alam // / //
analyzed: tathā haseyam ca raṭeyam ca śivā iti alam
translated: And likewise, I may laugh, jump, and chant Shiva enough.

original: viṣamastho 'pi svastho 'pi rudann api hasann api
analyzed: viṣama sthaḥ pi svasthaḥ pi rudan api hasan api
translated: Even in difficult situations, even in good health, even crying or laughing,

original: gambhīro 'pi vicitto 'pi bhaveyaṃ bhaktitaḥ prabho // / //
analyzed: gambhīraḥ pi vicittaḥ pi bhaveyam bhaktitaḥ prabho
translated: I may be deep or distracted, but devoted to you, O Lord.

original: bhaktānāṃ nāsti saṃvedyaṃ tvadantar yadi vā bahiḥ
analyzed: bhaktānām nā asti saṃvedyam tvad antar yadi vā bahis
translated: For devotees, there is nothing to be experienced outside of you or within you,

original: ciddharmā yatra na bhavān nirvikalpaḥ sthitaḥ svayam // / //🔽bhaktā nindānukare 'pi tavāmṛtakaṇair iva
analyzed: cit dharmā yatra na bhavān nirvikalpaḥ sthitaḥ svayam  bhaktāḥ nindā anukare tava amṛta kaṇaiḥ iva
translated: Where the nature of consciousness, you, the non-conceptual, do not abide by yourself.🔽Even in criticism of you, devotees rejoice, as if with drops of nectar,

original: hṛṣyanty evāntarāviddhās tīkṣṇaromāñcasūcibhiḥ // / //
analyzed: hṛṣyanti eva antar āviddhāḥ tīkṣṇa romāñca sūcibhiḥ
translated: Internally pierced by the needles of sharp horripilation.

original: duḥkhāpi vedanā bhaktimatāṃ bhogāya kalpate
analyzed: duḥkhā api vedanā bhaktimatām bhogāya kalpate
translated: Even painful feelings become a means of enjoyment for the devoted.

original: yeṣāṃ sudhārdrā sarvaiva saṃvit tvaccandrikāmayī // / //
analyzed: yeṣām sudhā ārdrā sarvā eva saṃvid tvad candrikā mayī
translated: whose entire consciousness is moistened by nectar, full of your moonlight.

original: yatra tatroparuddhānāṃ bhaktānāṃ bahirantare
analyzed: yatra tatra uparuddhānām bhaktānām bahis antare
translated: Wherever they are, whether restrained or unrestrained, inside or outside,

original: nirvyājaṃ tvadvapuḥsparśarasāsvādasukhaṃ samam // / //🔽taveśa bhakter arcāyāṃ dainyāṃśaṃ dvayasaṃśrayam
analyzed: nirvyājam tvad vapuḥ sparśa rasa āsvāda sukham samam  tava īśa bhakteḥ arcāyām dainya aṃśam dvaya saṃśrayam
translated: they equally experience the bliss of tasting the touch of your body without pretense.🔽Some, having removed the part of dejection that is based on both [body and mind] in the worship of your devotion,

original: vilupyāsvādayanty eke vapur acchaṃ sudhāmayam // / //
analyzed: vilupya āsvādayanti eke vapuḥ accham sudhā mayam
translated: enjoy your pure body, which is full of nectar.

original: bhrāntās tīrthadṛśo bhinnā bhrānter eva hi bhinnatā
analyzed: bhrāntāḥ tīrtha dṛśaḥ bhinnāḥ bhrānteḥ eva hi bhinna tā
translated: Those whose vision is deluded by the scriptures are divided, for division is indeed due to delusion.

original: niṣpratidvandvi vastv ekaṃ bhaktānāṃ tvaṃ tu rājase // / //
analyzed: niṣpratidvandvi vastu ekam bhaktānām tvam tu rājase
translated: But you shine forth as the one undivided reality for the devotees.

original: mānāvamānarāgādiniṣpākavimalaṃ manaḥ
analyzed: māna avamāna rāga ādi niṣpāka vimalam manaḥ
translated: The mind that is pure, free from the ripening of attachment, aversion, and so on,

original: yasyāsau bhaktimāṃl lokatulyaśīlaḥ kathaṃ bhavet // / //
analyzed: yasya asau bhaktimān loka tulya śīlaḥ katham bhavet
translated: how can that person who has devotion be equal in conduct to the world?

original: rāgadveṣandhakāro 'pi yeṣāṃ bhaktitviṣā jitaḥ
analyzed: rāga dveṣa ndhakāraḥ yeṣām bhakti tviṣā jitaḥ
translated: Even the darkness of attachment and aversion is conquered by the light of devotion

original: teṣāṃ mahīyasām agre katame jñānaśālinaḥ // / //
analyzed: teṣām mahīyasām agre katame jñāna śālinaḥ
translated: for those great ones, what are the ones who are endowed with knowledge?

original: yasya bhaktisudhāsnānapānādividhisādhanam
translated: For him who has the means of bathing, drinking, and so on with the nectar of devotion,

original: tasya prārabdhamadhyāntadaśāsūccaiḥ sukhāsikā // / //
analyzed: tasya prārabdha madhya anta daśāsu uccais sukhāsikā
translated: he has a high and pleasant time in the beginning, middle, and end of his life.

original: kīrtyaś cintāpadaṃ mṛgyaḥ pūjyo yena tvam eva tat
analyzed: kīrtyaḥ cintā padam mṛgyaḥ pūjyaḥ yena tvam eva tat
translated: By whom you are sought as the object of thought, to be worshipped, that is

original: bhavadbhaktimatāṃ ślāghyā lokayātrā bhavanmayī // / //
analyzed: bhavat bhaktimatām ślāghyā lokayātrā bhavat mayī
translated: The worldly life of those who are devoted to you is to be envied, as it is full of you.

original: muktisaṃjñā vipakvāyā bhakter eva tvayi prabho
analyzed: mukti saṃjñā vipakvāyāḥ bhakteḥ eva tvayi prabho
translated: O Lord, the liberation that is known as the fully ripened devotion to you,

original: tasyām ādyadaśārūḍhā muktakalpā vayaṃ tataḥ // / //
analyzed: tasyām ādya daśa ārūḍhāḥ mukta kalpāḥ vayam tatas
translated: we are like liberated souls when we attain that first stage.

original: duḥkhāgamo 'pi bhūyān me tvadbhaktibharitātmanaḥ
analyzed: duḥkha āgamaḥ bhūyāt me tvad bhakti bharita ātmanaḥ
translated: Even if there is much suffering for me, my mind is filled with devotion to you.

original: tvatparācī vibho mā bhūd api saukhyaparamparā // / //
analyzed: tvad parācī vibho mā bhūt api saukhya paramparā
translated: O Lord, may there be no succession of happiness turning away from you.

original: tvaṃ bhaktyā prīyase bhaktiḥ prīte tvayi ca nātha yat
analyzed: tvam bhaktyā prīyase bhaktiḥ prīte tvayi ca nātha yat
translated: You are pleased with devotion, and devotion is in you, O Lord, when you are pleased.

original: tadanyonyāśrayaṃ yuktaṃ yathā vettha tvam eva tat // / //
analyzed: tad anyonya āśrayam yuktam yathā vettha tvam eva tat
translated: That mutual dependence is proper, just as you know it yourself.

original: sākāro vā nirākaro vāntar vā bahir eva vā
analyzed: sa ākāraḥ vā nirākaraḥ vā antar vā bahis eva vā
translated: Whether with form or without form, internally or externally,

original: bhaktimattātmanāṃ nātha sarvathāsi sudhāmayaḥ // / //
analyzed: bhaktimat tā ātmanām nātha sarvathā asi sudhā mayaḥ
translated: O Lord, you are always full of nectar for those whose minds are full of devotion.

original: asminn eva jagaty antar bhavadbhaktimataḥ prati
analyzed: asmin eva jagati antar bhavat bhaktimataḥ prati
translated: In this very world, for one who is devoted to you,

original: harṣaprakāśanaphalam anyad eva jagatsthitam // / //
analyzed: harṣa prakāśana phalam anyat eva jagat sthitam
translated: another world exists, the fruit of which is the manifestation of joy.

original: guhye bhaktiḥ pare bhaktir bhaktir viśvamaheśvare
analyzed: guhye bhaktiḥ pare bhaktiḥ bhaktiḥ viśva maheśvare
translated: Devotion in the secret, devotion in the supreme, devotion in the great Lord of the universe,

original: tvayi śambhau śive deva bhaktir nāma kim apy aho // / //
analyzed: tvayi śambhau śive deva bhaktiḥ nāma kim api aho
translated: O Shambhu, Shiva, God, devotion to you is indeed something wonderful.

original: bhaktir bhaktiḥ pare bhaktir bhaktir nāma samutkaṭā
analyzed: bhaktiḥ bhaktiḥ pare bhaktiḥ bhaktiḥ nāma samutkaṭā
translated: Devotion, devotion, supreme devotion, devotion is the most exalted

original: tāraṃ viraumi yat tīvrā bhaktir me 'stu paraṃ tvayi // / //
analyzed: tāram viraumi yat tīvrā bhaktiḥ me stu param tvayi
translated: I cry out for the highest, may I have intense devotion towards you.

original: yato 'smi sarvaśobhānāṃ prasavāvanir īśa tat
analyzed: yatas smi sarva śobhānām prasava avaniḥ īśa tat
translated: O Lord, since I am the ground for the birth of all beauty,

original: tvayi lagnam anarghaṃ syād ratnam vā yadi vā tṛṇam // / //
analyzed: tvayi lagnam anargham syāt ratnam vā yadi vā tṛṇam
translated: whether it be a priceless jewel or a blade of grass, it becomes priceless when attached to you.

original: āvedakād ā ca vedyād yeṣāṃ saṃvedanādhvani
analyzed: āvedakāt ā ca vedyāt yeṣām saṃvedana adhvani
translated: Those who are beyond the path of knowledge and the knowable,

original: bhavatā na viyogo 'sti te jayanti bhavajjuṣaḥ // / //
analyzed: bhavatā na viyogaḥ sti te jayanti bhavat juṣaḥ
translated: you are never separate from them, they who enjoy you are victorious.

original: saṃsārasadaso bāhye kaiś cittvaṃ parirabhyase
analyzed: saṃsāra sadasaḥ bāhye kaiḥ cit tvam parirabhyase
translated: Some embrace you outside the assembly of worldly existence,

original: svāmin parais tu tatraiva tāmyadbhis tyaktayantraṇaiḥ // / //🔽pānāśanaprasādhanasambhuktasamastaviśvayā śivayā
analyzed: svāmin paraiḥ tu tatra eva tāmyadbhiḥ tyakta yantraṇaiḥ  pāna aśana prasādhana sambhukta samasta viśvayā śivayā
translated: O Lord, but others, distressed, give up all restraint right there.🔽I praise Shiva, firmly embraced by Shiva, who enjoys the entire universe through drinking, eating, and adorning,

original: pralayotsavasarabhasayā dṛḍham upagūḍhaṃ śivaṃ vande // / //
analyzed: pralaya utsava sarabhasayā dṛḍham upagūḍham śivam vande
translated: who is passionate in the joy of the festival of dissolution.

original: parameśvaratā jayaty apūrvā tava viśveśa yadīśitavyaśūnyā
analyzed: parameśvara tā jayati apūrvā tava viśveśa yadi īśitavya śūnyā
translated: The lordship of the Supreme Lord is unprecedented, O Lord of the universe, if it is devoid of what is to be ruled.

original: aparāpi tathaiva te yayedaṃ jagad ābhāti yathā tathā na bhāti // / //
analyzed: aparā api tathā eva te yayā idam jagat ābhāti yathā tathā na bhāti
translated: The other one is also like that, by which this world shines forth, and does not shine forth as it is.

original: divyakrīḍābahumānanāma saptadasaṃ stotram
analyzed: divyakrīḍā bahu māna nāma saptadasam stotram
translated: The seventeenth hymn named Divine Play and Great Respect

original: aho ko 'pi jayaty eṣa svāduḥ pūjāmahotsavaḥ
analyzed: aho kaḥ pi jayati eṣa svāduḥ pūjā mahā utsavaḥ
translated: Oh, this wonderful festival of worship is indeed sweet and victorious!

original: yato 'mṛtarasāsvādam aśrūṇy api dadaty alam // / //
analyzed: yatas mṛta rasa āsvādam aśrūṇi api dadati alam
translated: For even tears are sufficient to taste the nectar of bliss.

original: vyāpārāḥ siddhidāḥ sarve ye tvatpūjāpuraḥsarāḥ
analyzed: vyāpārāḥ siddhi dāḥ sarve ye tvad pūjā puraḥsarāḥ
translated: All activities that precede your worship are bestowers of perfection.

original: bhaktānāṃ tvanmayāḥ sarve svayaṃ siddhaya eva te // / //🔽sarvadā sarvabhāveṣu yugapat sarvarūpiṇam
analyzed: bhaktānām tvad mayāḥ sarve svayam siddhayaḥ eva te  sarvadā sarva bhāveṣu yugapad sarva rūpiṇam
translated: For devotees, all of them are pervaded by you and are perfected by you.🔽Those who constantly worship you, who are always present in all things and forms simultaneously,

original: tvām arcayanty aviśrantaṃ ye mamaite 'dhidevatāḥ // / //
analyzed: tvām arcayanti a viśrantam ye mama ete dhidevatāḥ
translated: are my supreme deities.

original: dhyānāyasatiraskārasiddhas tvatsparśanotsavaḥ
analyzed: dhyāna āyasa tiraskāra siddhaḥ tvad sparśana utsavaḥ
translated: The festival of touching you, which is accomplished by the exclusion of meditation,

original: pūjāvidhir iti khyāto bhaktānāṃ sa sadās tu me // / //
analyzed: pūjā vidhiḥ iti khyātaḥ bhaktānām sa sadā tu me
translated: is known as the method of worship and is always mine for the devotees.

original: bhaktānāṃ samatāsāraviṣuvatsamayaḥ sadā
analyzed: bhaktānām sama tā sāra viṣuvat samayaḥ sadā
translated: The devotees are always in the equinoctial moment of the essence of equality,

original: tvadbhāvarasapīyūṣarasennaiṣāṃ sadārcanam // / //
analyzed: tvad bhāva rasa pīyūṣa raset na eṣām sadā arcanam
translated: and their constant worship is not separate from the nectar of the essence of your nature.

original: yasyānārambhaparyantau na ca kālakramaḥ prabho
analyzed: yasya anārambha paryantau na ca kāla kramaḥ prabho
translated: For one who has no beginning or end and no passage of time, O Lord,

original: pūjātmāsau kriyā tasyāḥ kartāras tvajjuṣaḥ param // / //
analyzed: pūjā ātmā asau kriyā tasyāḥ kartāraḥ tvad juṣaḥ param
translated: the worship is the self of that action, and the performers are those who delight in you.

original: brahmādīnām apīśāste te ca saubhāgyabhāginaḥ
analyzed: brahma ādīnām api īśāḥ te te ca saubhāgya bhāginaḥ
translated: Even Brahma and others are under your control, and they are fortunate

original: yeṣāṃ svapne 'pi mohe 'pi sthitas tvatpūjanotsavaḥ // / //
analyzed: yeṣām svapne pi mohe pi sthitaḥ tvad pūjana utsavaḥ
translated: whose festival of worshipping you is present even in dreams or delusion.

original: japatāṃ juhvatāṃ snātāṃ dhyāyatāṃ na ca kevalam
analyzed: japatām juhvatām snātām dhyāyatām na ca kevalam
translated: Not only for those who chant, offer oblations, bathe, and meditate,

original: bhaktānāṃ bhavadabhyarcāmaho yāvad yadā tadā // / //
analyzed: bhaktānām bhavat abhyarcāmahaḥ yāvat yadā tadā
translated: But for the devotees who worship you, O great one, when and how long?

original: bhavatpūjāsudhāsvādasambhogasukhinaḥ sadā
analyzed: bhavat pūjā sudhā āsvāda sambhoga sukhinaḥ sadā
translated: Always happy with the enjoyment of the nectar of worshipping you,

original: indrādīnām atha brahmamukhyānām asti kaḥ samaḥ // / //
analyzed: indra ādīnām atha brahma mukhyānām asti kaḥ samaḥ
translated: Who is equal to Indra and others, and to Brahma and the chief ones?

original: jagatkṣobhaikajanake bhavatpūjāmahotsave
analyzed: jagat kṣobha eka janake bhavat pūjā mahā utsave
translated: In the great festival of worshipping you, which causes the agitation of the world,

original: yatprāpyaṃ prāpyate kiṃcid bhaktā eva vidanti tat // / //
analyzed: yat prāpyam prāpyate kiṃcid bhaktāḥ eva vidanti tat
translated: The devotees alone know what is attained when something is attained.

original: tvaddhāmni cinmaye sthitvā ṣaṭtriṃśattattvakarmabhiḥ
analyzed: tvad dhāmni cit maye sthitvā ṣaṭtriṃśat tattva karmabhiḥ
translated: Residing in your abode of pure consciousness, with the actions of the thirty-six principles,

original: kāyavākcittaceṣṭādyair arcaye tvāṃ sadā vibho // / //
analyzed: kāya vāc citta ceṣṭā ādyaiḥ arcaye tvām sadā vibho
translated: With the movements of body, speech, and mind, O Lord, I always worship you.

original: bhavatpūjāmayāsaṅgasambhogasukhino mama
analyzed: bhavat pūjā maya āsaṅga sambhoga sukhinaḥ mama
translated: I, who am happy with the enjoyment of the attachment to the essence of worshipping you,

original: prayātu kālaḥ sakalo 'py ananto 'pīyadarthaye // / //
analyzed: prayātu kālaḥ
translated: May all time pass, even if it is endless, I still desire this.

original: bhavatpūjāmṛtarasābhogalampaṭata vibho
analyzed: vibho
translated: O Lord, I am greedy for the enjoyment of the nectar of worshipping you,

original: vivardhatām anudinaṃ sadā ca phalatāṃ mama // / //
analyzed: vivardhatām anudinam sadā ca phalatām mama
translated: May it increase day by day, and always bear fruit for me.

original: jagadvilayasañjātasudhaikarasanirbhare
analyzed: jagat vilaya sañjāta sudhā eka rasa nirbhare
translated: In your ocean, which is full of the sole essence of the nectar born from the dissolution of the world,

original: tvadabdhau tvāṃ mahātmānam arcannāsīya sarvadā // / //
analyzed: tvad abdhau tvām mahātmānam arcan āsīya sarvadā
translated: Always worshipping you, the great soul, may I remain.

original: aśeṣavāsanāgranthivicchedasaralaṃ sadā
analyzed: aśeṣa vāsanā granthi viccheda saralam sadā
translated: The mind, which is always simple due to the severance of all the knots of latent impressions,

original: mano nivedyate bhaktaiḥ svādu pūjāvidhau tava // / //
analyzed: manaḥ nivedyate bhaktaiḥ svādu pūjā vidhau tava
translated: is offered by devotees in the delicious rite of your worship.

original: adhiṣṭhāyaiva viṣayānimāḥ karaṇavṛttayaḥ
analyzed: adhiṣṭhāya eva viṣayān imāḥ karaṇa vṛttayaḥ
translated: The functions of the senses, having taken hold of these objects,

original: bhaktānāṃ preṣayanti svatpūjārtham amṛtāsavam // / //
analyzed: bhaktānām preṣayanti svad pūjā artham amṛta āsavam
translated: send forth their own nectar for the worship of devotees.

original: bhaktānāṃ bhaktisaṃvegamahoṣmavivaśātmanām
analyzed: bhaktānām bhakti saṃvega mahā ūṣma vivaśa ātmanām
translated: For devotees whose minds are overwhelmed by the great heat of the fervor of devotion,

original: ko 'nyo nirvāṇahetuḥ syāt tvatpūjāmṛtamajjanāt // / //
analyzed: kaḥ nyaḥ nirvāṇa hetuḥ syāt tvad pūjā amṛta majjanāt
translated: what other cause of liberation could there be than the nectar bath of your worship?

original: satataṃ tvatpadābhyarcāsudhāpānamahotsavaḥ
analyzed: satatam tvad pada abhyarcā sudhā pāna mahā utsavaḥ
translated: May the great festival of constantly drinking the nectar of worshipping your feet

original: tvatprasādaikasamprāptihetur me nātha kalpatām // / //🔽anubhūyāsamīśāna pratikarma kṣaṇāt kṣaṇam
analyzed: tvad prasāda eka samprāpti hetuḥ me nātha kalpatām  anubhūyāsam īśāna pratikarma kṣaṇāt kṣaṇam
translated: be the sole cause of attaining your grace, O Lord.🔽O Lord, may you experience every moment,

original: bhavatpūjāmṛtāpānamadāsvādamahāmudam // / //
analyzed: bhavat pūjā amṛta apāna mada āsvāda mahā mudam
translated: the great joy of drinking the nectar of your worship, which is beyond imagination.

original: dṛṣṭartha eva bhaktānāṃ bhavatpūjāmahodyamaḥ
analyzed: dṛṣṭa arthaḥ eva bhaktānām bhavat pūjā mahā udyamaḥ
translated: The great endeavor of devotees in worshipping you is indeed for the sake of the visible goal,

original: tadaiva yad asambhāvyaṃ sukham āsvādayanti te // / //
analyzed: tadā eva yat asambhāvyam sukham āsvādayanti te
translated: since they experience such indescribable bliss at that very moment.

original: yāvan na labdhas tvatpūjāsudhāsvādamahotsavaḥ
analyzed: yāvat na labdhaḥ tvad pūjā sudhā āsvāda mahā utsavaḥ
translated: As long as the great festival of tasting the nectar of worshipping you is not attained,

original: tāvan nāsvādito manye lavo 'pi sukhasampadaḥ // / //
analyzed: tāvat nā āsvāditaḥ manye lavaḥ pi sukha sampadaḥ
translated: I think even a moment of the wealth of happiness is not tasted.

original: bhaktānāṃ viṣayanveṣābhāsāyāsād vinaiva sā
analyzed: bhaktānām viṣaya anveṣa ābhāsa āyāsāt vinā eva sā
translated: Without the trouble of the appearance of searching for objects,

original: ayatnasiddhaṃ tvaddhāmasthitiḥ pūjāsu jāyate // / //
analyzed: ayatna siddham tvad dhāma sthitiḥ pūjāsu jāyate
translated: The state of being in your abode, effortlessly accomplished, arises in the course of worship.

original: na prāpyam asti bhaktanāṃ nāpy eṣām asti durlabham
analyzed: na prāpyam asti na api eṣām asti durlabham
translated: For the devotees, there is nothing unattainable, nor is there anything difficult to obtain for them.

original: kevalaṃ vicaranty ete bhavatpūjāmadonmadāḥ // / //
analyzed: kevalam vicaranti ete bhavat pūjā mada unmadāḥ
translated: They simply roam about, intoxicated with the pride of worshipping you.

original: aho bhaktibharodāracetasāṃ varada tvayi
analyzed: aho bhakti bhara udāra cetasām vara da tvayi
translated: Oh, the greatness of the hearts of those who are full of devotion to you, O Bestower of Boons!

original: slāghyaḥ pūjāvidhiḥ ko 'pi yo na yācñākalaṃkitaḥ // / //
analyzed: slāghyaḥ pūjā vidhiḥ kaḥ pi yaḥ na yācñā kalaṃkitaḥ
translated: The method of worship is praiseworthy, indeed, which is not marred by begging.

original: kā na śobhā na ko hlādaḥ kā samṛddhir na vāparā
analyzed: kā na śobhā na kaḥ hlādaḥ kā samṛddhiḥ na vā aparā
translated: What is not beautiful? What is not delightful? What is not prosperity?

original: ko vā na mokṣaḥ ko 'py eṣa mahādevo yad arcyate // / //🔽antarullasadacchācchabhaktipīyūṣapoṣitam
analyzed: kaḥ vā na mokṣaḥ kaḥ api eṣa mahādevaḥ yat arcyate  antar ullasat accha accha bhakti pīyūṣa poṣitam
translated: What is not liberation? It is indeed this great God who is worshipped.🔽May this body of mine be nourished by the nectar of pure devotion that wells up within,

original: bhavatpūjopayogāya śarīram idam astu me // / //
analyzed: bhavat pūjā upayogāya śarīram idam astu me
translated: for the purpose of worshipping you, O Lord.

original: tvatpādapūjāsambhogaparatantraḥ sadā vibho
analyzed: tvad pāda pūjā sambhoga paratantraḥ sadā vibho
translated: May I always be dependent on enjoying the worship of your feet, O Lord,

original: bhūyāsaṃ jagatām īśa ekaḥ svacchandaceṣṭitaḥ // / //
analyzed: bhūyāsam jagatām īśaḥ ekaḥ svacchanda ceṣṭitaḥ
translated: the only one, O Lord of the worlds, acting independently.

original: tvaddhyānadarśanasparśatṛṣi keṣām api prabho
analyzed: tvad dhyāna darśana sparśa tṛṣi keṣām api prabho
translated: For some, O Lord, who thirst for the sight and touch of your meditation,

original: jāyate śītalasvādu bhavatpūjāmahāsaraḥ // / //
analyzed: jāyate śītala svādu bhavat pūjā mahā saraḥ
translated: there arises the great lake of your worship, cool and sweet.

original: yathā tvam eva jagataḥ pūjāsambhogabhājanam
analyzed: yathā tvam eva jagataḥ pūjā sambhoga bhājanam
translated: Just as you alone are the vessel for enjoying the worship of the world,

original: tatheśa bhaktimān eva pūjāsambhogabhājanam // / //
analyzed: tathā īśa bhaktimān eva pūjā sambhoga bhājanam
translated: And likewise, one who is devoted to you alone is a vessel for the enjoyment of worship.

original: ko 'py asau jayati svāmin bhavatpūjāmahotsavaḥ
analyzed: kaḥ pi asau jayati svāmin bhavat pūjā mahā utsavaḥ
translated: O Lord, that great festival of your worship, which is something, triumphs.

original: ṣaṭtriṃśato 'pi tattvānāṃ kṣobho yatrollasaty alam // / //
analyzed: tattvānām kṣobhaḥ yatra ullasati alam
translated: Wherein the agitation of even the thirty-six principles shines forth abundantly.

original: namas tebhyo vibho yeṣāṃ bhaktipīyūṣavāriṇā
analyzed: namaḥ tebhyaḥ vibho yeṣām bhakti pīyūṣa vāriṇā
translated: Salutations to those Lords, by whose nectar-like water of devotion

original: pūjyāny eva bhavanti tvatpūjopakaraṇāny api // / //
analyzed: pūjyāni eva bhavanti tvad pūjā upakaraṇāni api
translated: Even the objects of worship become worthy of worship.

original: pūjārambhe vibho dhyātvā mantrādheyāṃ tvadātmatām
analyzed: pūjā ārambhe vibho dhyātvā mantra ādheyām tvad ātma tām
translated: O Lord, at the beginning of worship, having meditated on the identity with you that is to be attained through the mantras

original: svātmany eva pare bhaktā mānti harṣeṇa na kvacit // / //
analyzed: sva ātmani eva pare bhaktāḥ mānti harṣeṇa na kvacid
translated: The devotees abide in the highest bliss in their own selves alone, not anywhere else.

original: rājyalābhādivotphullaiḥ kaiś cit pūjāmahotsave
analyzed: rājya lābhāt iva utphullaiḥ kaiḥ cit pūjā mahā utsave
translated: By some who are elated like by the gain of a kingdom in the great festival of worship

original: sudhāsavena sakalā jagatī saṃvibhajyate // / //
analyzed: sudhā āsavena sakalā jagatī saṃvibhajyate
translated: The entire world is divided by the nectar-like drink.

original: pūjāmṛtāpānamayo yeṣāṃ bhogaḥ pratikṣaṇam
analyzed: pūjā amṛta apāna mayaḥ yeṣām bhogaḥ pratikṣaṇam
translated: For those whose enjoyment every moment consists of drinking the nectar of worship

original: kiṃ devā uta muktās te kiṃ vā ke 'py eva te janāḥ // / //
analyzed: kim devāḥ uta muktāḥ te kim vā ke pi eva te janāḥ
translated: Are they gods or are they liberated souls or are they some other people?

original: pūjopakaraṇībhūtaviśvaveśena gauravam
analyzed: pūjā upakaraṇībhūta viśva veśena gauravam
translated: By the universe becoming the means of worship, there is respect

original: aho kim api bhaktānāṃ kim apy eva ca lāghavam // / //
analyzed: aho kim api bhaktānām kim api eva ca lāghavam
translated: Oh! Something indeed for the devotees and something indeed is the lightness (of being).

original: pūjāmayākṣavikṣepakṣobhādevāmṛtodgamaḥ
analyzed: pūjā maya akṣa vikṣepa kṣobhāt eva amṛta udgamaḥ
translated: The rising of nectar is indeed only from the agitation caused by the scattering of the dice of worship.

original: bhaktānāṃ kṣīrajaladhikṣobhād iva divaukasām // / //
analyzed: bhaktānām kṣīra jaladhi kṣobhāt iva divaukasām
translated: For the devotees, like the gods from the churning of the milk ocean.

original: pūjāṃ ke cana manyante dhenuṃ kāmadughām iva
analyzed: pūjām ke cana manyante dhenum kāmadughām iva
translated: Some consider worship to be like a wish-fulfilling cow,

original: sudhādhārādhikarasāṃ dhayanty antarmukhāḥ pare // / //
analyzed: sudhā dhārā adhika rasām dhayanti antar mukhāḥ pare
translated: While others suck the nectar-like essence that surpasses the flow of ambrosia.

original: bhaktānām akṣavikṣepo 'py eṣa saṃsārasaṃmataḥ
analyzed: bhaktānām akṣa vikṣepaḥ pi eṣa saṃsāra saṃmataḥ
translated: For the devotees, even the blinking of an eye is considered worldly existence.

original: upanīya kim apy antaḥ puṣṇāty arcāmahotsavam // / //
analyzed: upanīya kim api antar puṣṇāti arcā mahā utsavam
translated: Having brought something, it nourishes the great festival of worship within.

original: bhaktikṣobhavaśād īśa svātmabhūte 'rcanaṃ tvayi
analyzed: bhakti kṣobha vaśāt īśa sva ātma bhūte arcanam tvayi
translated: O Lord, due to the loss of devotion, worship towards you, who are self-existent,

original: citraṃ dainyāya no yāvad dīnatāyāḥ paraṃ phalam // / //
analyzed: citram dainyāya naḥ yāvat dīna tāyāḥ param phalam
translated: It is strange that it leads to misery, the highest fruit of humility.

original: upacārapadaṃ pūjā keṣāṃ cit tvatpadāptaye
analyzed: upacāra padam pūjā keṣām cit tvad pada āptaye
translated: For some, the stage of service is worship for attaining your state,

original: bhaktānāṃ bhavadaikātmyanirvṛttiprasaras tu saḥ // / //
analyzed: bhaktānām bhavat aikātmya nirvṛtti prasaraḥ tu saḥ
translated: But for the devotees, it is the flow of accomplishment in oneness with existence.

original: apy asambaddharūpārcābhaktyunmādanirargalaiḥ
analyzed: api a sambaddha rūpa arcā bhakti unmāda nirargalaiḥ
translated: Even with the unrestrained madness of devotion towards worship in an unrelated form,

original: vitanyamānā labhate pratiṣṭhāṃ tvayi kām api // / //🔽svādubhaktirasāsvādastabdhībhūtamanaś cyutām
analyzed: vitanyamānā labhate pratiṣṭhām tvayi kām api  svādu bhakti rasa āsvāda stabdhībhūta manaḥ cyutām
translated: It attains some kind of establishment in you.🔽O Shambhu, you alone are the graceful recipient of worship,

original: śambho tvam eva lalitaḥ pūjānāṃ kila bhājanam // / //
analyzed: śambho tvam eva lalitaḥ pūjānām kila bhājanam
translated: Whose mind has become rigid due to the taste of the essence of devotion.

original: paripūrṇāni śuddhāni bhaktimanti sthirāṇi ca
analyzed: paripūrṇāni śuddhāni bhaktimanti sthirāṇi ca
translated: Complete, pure, devoted, and stable,

original: bhavatpūjāvidhau nātha sādhanāni bhavantu me // / //
analyzed: bhavat pūjā vidhau nātha sādhanāni bhavantu me
translated: May they be my means in the rite of worshipping You, O Lord.

original: aśeṣapūjāsatkośe tvatpūjākarmaṇi prabho
analyzed: aśeṣa pūjā sat kośe tvad pūjā karmaṇi prabho
translated: In the excellent treasury of all worship, in the rite of worshipping You, O Lord,

original: aho karaṇavṛndasya kāpi lakṣmīr vijṛmbhate // / //
analyzed: aho karaṇa vṛndasya kā api lakṣmīḥ vijṛmbhate
translated: Ah! Some splendor of the group of instruments shines forth.

original: eṣā peśalimā nātha tavaiva kila dṛśyate
analyzed: eṣā peśalimā nātha tava eva kila dṛśyate
translated: This gracefulness, O Lord, is indeed seen to be Yours alone,

original: viśveśvaro 'pi bhṛtyair yad arcyase yaś ca labhyase // / //
analyzed: viśveśvaraḥ u pi bhṛtyaiḥ yat arcyase yaḥ ca labhyase
translated: Since You, the Lord of the universe, are worshipped and attained by Your servants.

original: sadāmurttād amūrttādvā bhāvād yad vāpy abhāvataḥ
analyzed: sadā amurttāt amūrttāt vā bhāvāt yat vā api abhāvataḥ
translated: Whether arising from an existent or non-existent entity,

original: uttheyān me praśastasya bhavatpūjāmahotsavaḥ // / //
analyzed: uttheyāt me praśastasya bhavat pūjā mahā utsavaḥ
translated: May the great festival of worshipping You, which is praiseworthy, arise for me.

original: kāmakrodhābhimānais tvām upaharīkṛtaiḥ sadā
analyzed: kāma krodha abhimānaiḥ tvām upaharīkṛtaiḥ sadā
translated: Those who always worship You with desire, anger, and pride, which are offered to You,

original: ye 'rcayanti namas tebhyas teṣāṃ tuṣṭo 'smi tattvataḥ // / //
analyzed: ye rcayanti namaḥ tebhyaḥ teṣām tuṣṭaḥ smi tattvataḥ
translated: I bow to them, I am truly satisfied with them.

original: jayaty eṣa bhavadbhaktibhājāṃ pūjāvidhiḥ paraḥ
analyzed: jayati eṣa bhavat bhakti bhājām pūjā vidhiḥ paraḥ
translated: This supreme rite of worship of those who enjoy devotion to You is victorious,

original: yas tṛṇaiḥ kriyamāno 'pi ratnair evopakalpate // / //
analyzed: yaḥ tṛṇaiḥ kriyamānaḥ upi ratnaiḥ eva upakalpate
translated: Which, even when performed with grass, is considered to be with jewels.

original: āviṣkāranāma aṣṭādaśaṃ stotram
analyzed: āviṣkāra nāma aṣṭādaśam stotram
translated: The eighteenth hymn named Revelation

original: jagato 'ntarato bhavantam āptvā punar etad bhavato 'ntarāl labhante
analyzed: jagataḥ ntaratas bhavantam āptvā punar etat bhavataḥ ntarāt labhante
translated: Having attained You within the world, they obtain You again from within You,

original: jagadīśa tavaiva bhaktibhājo na hi teṣām iha dūrato 'sti kiñcit // / //
analyzed: jagadīśa tava eva bhakti bhājaḥ na hi teṣām iha dūratas sti kiñcid
translated: O Lord of the universe, those who are devotees of yours have nothing that is far away here.

original: kvacid eva bhavān kvacid bhavānī sakalārthakramagarbhiṇī pradhānā
analyzed: kvacid eva bhavān kvacid bhavānī sakala artha krama garbhiṇī pradhānā
translated: In some places you are, in some places you are Pārvatī, the primary one who contains the entire sequence of meanings,

original: paramārthapade tu naiva devyā bhavato nāpi jatattrayasya bhedaḥ // / //
analyzed: paramārtha pade tu nā eva devyāḥ bhavataḥ nā api jatat trayasya bhedaḥ
translated: But in the state of ultimate truth, there is no difference between the Goddess, you, or the three worlds.

original: no jānate subhagam apy avalepavanto lokāḥ prayatnasubhagā nikhila hi bhāvāḥ
analyzed: no jānate subhagam api avalepavantaḥ lokāḥ prayatna subhagāḥ hi bhāvāḥ
translated: People who are arrogant do not know even the fortunate one. All things are indeed fortunate through effort.

original: cetaḥ punar yad idam udyatam apy avaiti naivātmarūpam iha hā tad aho hato 'smi // / //
analyzed: cetaḥ punar yat idam udyatam api avaiti nā eva ātma rūpam iha hā tat aho hataḥ smi
translated: But this mind, though raised up, does not know its own nature. Alas! I am indeed ruined.

original: bhavanmayasvātmanivāsalabdhasampadbharābhyarcitayuṣmadaṅghriḥ
analyzed: bhavat maya sva ātma nivāsa labdha sampad bhara abhyarcita yuṣmad aṅghriḥ
translated: Having attained the wealth of dwelling in your blissful self, worshipping your feet with the burden of that wealth,

original: na bhojanācchādanam apy ajasram apekṣate yas tam ahaṃ nato 'smi // / //
analyzed: na bhojana ācchādanam api ajasram apekṣate yaḥ tam aham nataḥ smi
translated: I bow to him who does not constantly expect even food and clothing.

original: sadā bhavaddehanivāsasvastho 'py antaḥ paraṃ dahyata eṣa lokaḥ
analyzed: sadā bhavat deha nivāsa svasthaḥ pi antar param dahyate eṣa lokaḥ
translated: Though always dwelling in your body, this world is burning intensely within.

original: tavecchayā tat kuru me yathātra tvadarcanānandamayo bhaveyam // / //
analyzed: tava icchayā tat kuru me yathā atra tvad arcana ānanda mayaḥ bhaveyam
translated: By your will, do that for me so that I may become full of the bliss of worshipping you.

original: svarasoditayuṣmadaṅghripadmadvayapūjāmṛtapānasaktacittaḥ
translated: With a mind absorbed in drinking the nectar of worshipping the two lotus feet that arise from your own essence,

original: sakārthacayeṣv ahaṃ bhaveyam sukhasaṃsparśanamātralokayātraḥ // / //
analyzed: sa ka artha cayeṣu aham bhaveyam sukha saṃsparśana mātra lokayātraḥ
translated: May I be in the midst of those who have wealth and purpose, with a life sustained by mere pleasant touch.

original: sakalavyavahāragocare sphuṭam antaḥ spurati tvayi prabho
analyzed: sakala vyavahāra gocare sphuṭam antar spurati tvayi prabho
translated: In the sphere of all worldly transactions, O Lord, the inner impulse towards You is clearly manifest.

original: upayānty apayānti cāniśam mama vastūni vibhāntu sarvadā // / //🔽satatam eva tavaiva pure 'thavāpy arahito vicareyam ahaṃ tvayā
analyzed: upayānti apayānti ca aniśam mama vastūni vibhāntu sarvadā  satatam eva tava eva pure a rahitaḥ vicareyam aham tvayā
translated: May my possessions come and go incessantly, may they always shine forth.🔽Either always in Your city or elsewhere, may I wander about without being separated from You.

original: kṣaṇalavo 'py atha mā sma bhavet sa me na vijaye nanu yatra bhavanmayaḥ // / //🔽bhavadaṅgaparisravatsuśītāmṛtapūrair bharite samantato 'pi
analyzed: kṣaṇa lavaḥ pi atha mā sma bhavet sa me na vijaye nanu yatra bhavat mayaḥ  bhavat aṅga parisravat suśīta amṛta pūraiḥ bharite
translated: Let not even a moment pass without me being filled with You, O Lord, where there is no victory.🔽Filled all around with the cool nectar flowing from Your limbs,

original: bhavadarcanasampadeha bhaktās tava saṃsārasaro 'ntare caranti // / //
analyzed: bhavat arcana sampadā iha bhaktāḥ tava saṃsāra saraḥ ntare caranti
translated: may Your devotees, O Lord, move about in the midst of the lake of worldly existence, in the abundance of worshipping You.

original: mahāmantratarucchāyāśītale tvanmahāvane
analyzed: mahā mantra taru chāyā śītale tvad mahā vane
translated: In Your great forest, cool with the shade of the great tree of mantra,

original: nijātmani sadā nātha vaseyaṃ tava pūjakaḥ // / //
analyzed: nija ātmani sadā nātha vaseyam tava pūjakaḥ
translated: O Lord, may I always dwell in my own self, worshipping You.

original: prativastu samastajīvataḥ pratibhāsi pratibhāmayo yathā
analyzed: prativastu samasta jīvataḥ pratibhāsi pratibhā mayaḥ yathā
translated: Just as the essence of consciousness appears as the reflection of every object to every living being,

original: mama nātha tathā puraḥ prathāṃ vraja netratrayaśūlaśobhitaḥ // / //
analyzed: mama nātha tathā puras prathām vraja netra traya śūla śobhitaḥ
translated: O Lord, in the same way, manifest before me, adorned with the trident and three eyes.

original: abhimānacarūpahārato mamatābhaktibhareṇa kalpitāt
analyzed: abhimāna carūpa hārataḥ mamatā bhakti bhareṇa kalpitāt
translated: From the removal of the form of pride, imagined through the abundance of devotion and possessiveness,

original: paritoṣagataḥ kadā bhavān mama sarvatra bhaved dṛśaḥ padam // / //
analyzed: paritoṣa gataḥ kadā bhavān mama sarvatra bhavet dṛśaḥ padam
translated: When will you become satisfied everywhere, the abode of my vision?

original: nivasanparamāmṛtābdhimadhye bhavadarcāvidhimātramagnacittaḥ
analyzed: nivasan parama amṛta abdhi madhye bhavat arcā vidhi mātra magna cittaḥ
translated: Dwelling in the middle of the ocean of supreme nectar, my mind immersed solely in the ritual of worshipping you,

original: sakalaṃ janavṛttam ācareyaṃ rasayan sarvata eva kiñcanāpi // / //
analyzed: sakalam jana vṛttam ācareyam rasayan sarvatas eva kiñcana api
translated: I shall conduct all the worldly activities, relishing everything as mere rasa.

original: bhavadīyam ihāstu vastu tattvaṃ vivarītuṃ ka ivātra pātram arthe
analyzed: bhavadīyam iha astu vastu tattvam vivarītum kaḥ iva atra pātram arthe
translated: Who here is worthy to reveal the truth of your existence?

original: idam eva hi nāmarūpaceṣṭādyasamaṃ te harate haro 'si yasmāt // / //
analyzed: idam eva hi nāma rūpa ceṣṭā ādi asamam te harate haro si yasmāt
translated: For this alone, O Hara, removes the inequality of your form, name, actions, etc., since you are Hara.

original: śāntaye na sukhalipsutā manāg bhaktisambhṛtamadeṣu taiḥ prabhoḥ
analyzed: śāntaye na sukha lipsu tā manāk bhakti sambhṛta madeṣu taiḥ prabhoḥ
translated: For the sake of peace, not for the slightest desire for happiness, by those whose minds are filled with devotion to the Lord,

original: mokṣamārgaṇaphalāpi nārthanā smaryate hṛdayahāriṇaḥ puraḥ // / //
analyzed: mokṣa mārgaṇa phalā api nā arthanā smaryate hṛdaya hāriṇaḥ puras
translated: Even the attainment of the path of liberation is not considered a goal in the presence of the heart-stealer.

original: jāgaretaradaśāthavā parā yāpi kācana manāg avasthiteḥ
analyzed: jāgara itara daśā athavā parā yā api kācana manāk avasthiteḥ
translated: Or whatever other state there may be, even slightly, of existence other than in the state of being awake,

original: bhaktibhājanajanasya sākhilā tvatsanāthamanaso mahotsavaḥ // / //
analyzed: bhakti bhājana janasya sā akhilā tvad sanātha manasaḥ mahā utsavaḥ
translated: For a person who is a vessel of devotion, that is a great festival for one whose mind is protected by you.

original: āmano 'kṣavalayasya vṛttayaḥ sarvataḥ śithilavṛttayo 'pi tāḥ
analyzed: āmano kṣavalayasya vṛttayaḥ sarvatas śithila vṛttayaḥ pi tāḥ
translated: Even the movements of the mind and senses, which are relaxed in every way,

original: tvām avāpya dṛḍhadīrghasaṃvido nātha bhaktidhanasoṣmaṇāṃ katham // / //
analyzed: tvām avāpya dṛḍha dīrgha saṃvidaḥ nātha bhakti dhana sa ūṣmaṇām katham
translated: Having attained you, O Lord, with firm, long-lasting devotion, how can those who are rich with the wealth of devotion be unhappy?

original: na ca vibhinnam asṛjyata kiñcid asty atha sukhetarad atra na nirmitam
analyzed: na ca vibhinnam asṛjyata kiñcid asti atha sukha itarat atra na nirmitam
translated: And nothing was created as separate, nor was anything created here as happiness or otherwise.

original: atha ca duḥkhi ca bhedi ca sarvathāpy asamavismayadhāma namo 'stu te // / //
analyzed: atha ca duḥkhi ca bhedi ca sarvathā api asamavismaya dhāma namaḥ stu te
translated: And yet, in every way, you are the abode of incomparable wonder. Salutations to you.

original: kharaniṣedhakhadāmṛtapūraṇocchalitadhautavikalpamalasya me
analyzed: khara niṣedha khada amṛta pūraṇa ucchalita dhauta vikalpa malasya me
translated: May I, whose impurities of conceptual thought have been washed by the rising water of the nectar of the destruction of the demon Khara,

original: dalitadurjayasaṃśayavairiṇas tvadavalokanam astu nirantaram // / //
analyzed: dalita durjaya saṃśaya vairiṇaḥ tvad avalokanam astu nirantaram
translated: And whose enemies of difficult-to-conquer doubts have been shattered, always behold you.

original: sphuṭam aviśa mām athāviśeyaṃ satataṃ nātha bhavantamasmi yasmāt
analyzed: sphuṭam aviśa mām atha āviśeyam satatam nātha bhavantam asmi yasmāt
translated: You have clearly not entered me, yet I shall always enter you, O Lord, because I am yours.

original: rabhasena vapus tavaiva sākṣāt paramāsattigataḥ samarcayeyam // / //
analyzed: rabhasena vapuḥ tava eva sākṣāt parama āsatti gataḥ samarcayeyam
translated: With haste, having attained the highest intimacy, I shall worship your very form.

original: tvayi na stutiśaktir asti kasyāpy athavāsty eva yato 'tisundaro 'si
analyzed: tvayi na stuti śaktiḥ asti kasya api athavā asti eva yatas si
translated: In you, no one has the power to praise, or rather, it exists, since you are extremely beautiful.

original: satataṃ punar arthitaṃ mamaitad yad aviśrānti vilokayeyam īśam // / //🔽udyotanābhidhānam ekonaviṃśaṃ stotram🔽prārthanābhūmikātītavicitraphaladāyakaḥ
analyzed: satatam punar arthitam mama etat yat aviśrānti vilokayeyam īśam 🔽udyotana abhidhānam ekonaviṃśam stotram 🔽
translated: But this is always my request: that I may behold the Lord without interruption.

original: jayaty apūrvavṛttāntaḥ śivaḥ satkalpapādapaḥ // / //
analyzed: jayati apūrva vṛttāntaḥ śivaḥ sat kalpapādapaḥ
translated: is victorious, the auspicious wish-fulfilling tree of good kalpas.

original: sarvavastuni ca yaikanidhānāt svātmanas tvad akhilaṃ kila labhyam
analyzed: sarva vastuni ca yā eka nidhānāt sva ātmanaḥ tvat akhilam kila labhyam
translated: From you alone, the sole treasure of all things, everything is indeed obtainable for one's own self.

original: asya me punar asau nijā ātmā na tvam eva ghaṭase paramās tām // / //
analyzed: asya me punar asau nijaḥ ātmā na tvam eva ghaṭase paramāḥ tām
translated: But this supreme self of mine is not you alone, it appears in the highest form.

original: jñānakarmamayacidvapur ātmā sarvathaiṣa parameśvara eva
analyzed: jñāna karma maya cit vapuḥ ātmā sarvathā eṣa parameśvaraḥ eva
translated: The self, whose body is of knowledge and action, is in every way the Supreme Lord himself.

original: syād vapus tu nikhileṣu padārtheṣv eṣu nāma na bhavet kim utānyat // / //
analyzed: syāt vapuḥ tu nikhileṣu padārtheṣu eṣu nāma na bhavet kim uta anyat
translated: But his body would be in all things, so why not in these?

original: viṣamārtimuṣānena phalena tvaddṛgātmanā
analyzed: viṣama ārtim uṣānena phalena tvad dṛś ātmanā
translated: By this fruit, which removes the pain of poison, with your eye-like self,

original: abhilīya pathā nātha mamāstu tvanmayī gatiḥ // / //🔽bhavadamalacaraṇacintāratnalatālaṅkṛtā kadā siddhiḥ
analyzed: abhilīya pathā nātha mama astu tvad mayī gatiḥ  bhavat amala caraṇa cintā ratna latā alaṅkṛtā kadā siddhiḥ
translated: having merged on the path, O Lord, may my goal be one with you.🔽When will there be success, adorned by the wish-fulfilling creeper of your pure feet,

original: siddhajanamānasānāṃ vismayajananī ghaṭeta mama bhavataḥ // / //
analyzed: siddha jana mānasānām vismaya jananī ghaṭeta mama bhavataḥ
translated: which generates wonder for the minds of the accomplished ones, of you, O Lord?

original: karhi nātha vimalaṃ mukhabimbaṃ tāvakaṃ samavalokayitāsmi
analyzed: karhi nātha vimalam mukha bimbam tāvakam samavalokayitāsmi
translated: When, O Lord, shall I behold your pure orb of a face,

original: yatsravaty amṛtapūram apūrvaṃ yo nimajjayati viśvam aśeṣam // / //
analyzed: yat sravati amṛta pūram apūrvam yaḥ nimajjayati viśvam aśeṣam
translated: from which flows the unprecedented flood of nectar, in which the entire universe is immersed?

original: dhyātamātramuditaṃ tava rūpaṃ karhi nātha paramāmṛtapūraiḥ
analyzed: dhyāta mātram uditam tava rūpam karhi nātha parama amṛta pūraiḥ
translated: When, O Lord, will your form, which arises merely by being contemplated, with the highest floods of nectar,

original: pūrayet tvadavibhedavimokṣākhyātidūravivarāṇi sadā me // / //
analyzed: pūrayet tvad avibheda vimokṣa ākhyā ati dūra vivarāṇi sadā me
translated: May they always fill the vast distance of the fame of your unobstructed liberations.

original: tvadīyānuttararasāsaṅgasaṃtyaktacāpalam
analyzed: tvadīya anuttara rasa āsaṅga saṃtyakta cāpalam
translated: Your unsurpassed nectar-like attachment, abandoning fickleness,

original: nādyāpi me mano nātha karhi syād astu śīghrataḥ // / //
analyzed: na adyā api me manaḥ nātha karhi syāt astu śīghratas
translated: O Lord, may my mind never be so, may it be so quickly.

original: mā śuṣkakaṭukāny eva paraṃ sarvāṇi sarvadā
analyzed: mā śuṣka kaṭukāni eva param sarvāṇi sarvadā
translated: May all things never be completely dry, bitter, and so on,

original: tavopahṛtya labdhāni dvandvāny apy āpatantu me // / //
analyzed: tava upahṛtya labdhāni dvandvāni api āpatantu me
translated: having been offered to you, may even dualities befall me.

original: nātha sāṃmukhyam āyāntu viśuddhās tava raśmayaḥ
analyzed: nātha sāṃmukhyam āyāntu viśuddhāḥ tava raśmayaḥ
translated: O Lord, may your pure rays come face to face,

original: yāvat kāyamanastāpatamobhiḥ parilupyatām // / //
analyzed: yāvat kāya manaḥ tāpa tamobhiḥ parilupyatām
translated: as long as the heat and darkness of body and mind are destroyed.

original: deva prasīda yāvan me tvanmārgaparipanthikāḥ
analyzed: deva prasīda yāvat me tvad mārga paripanthikāḥ
translated: O God, be gracious, as long as your path's obstacles

original: paramārthamuṣo vaśyā bhūyāsur guṇataskarāḥ // / //
analyzed: parama artha muṣaḥ vaśyāḥ bhūyāsuḥ guṇa taskarāḥ
translated: become completely subdued, stealing the essence of ultimate truth.

original: tvad bhaktisudhāsārair mānasam āpūryatāṃ mamāśu vibho
analyzed: tvat bhakti sudhā sāraiḥ mānasam āpūryatām mama āśu vibho
translated: O Lord, may my mind be quickly filled with the essence of the nectar of devotion to you,

original: yāvad imā uhyantāṃ niḥśeṣāsāravāsanāḥ plutvā // / //
analyzed: yāvat imāḥ uhyantām niḥśeṣa asāra vāsanāḥ plutvā
translated: as long as these floating desires for the worthless are completely destroyed.

original: mokṣadaśāyāṃ bhaktis tvayi kuta iva martyadharmiṇo 'pi na sā
analyzed: mokṣa daśāyām bhaktiḥ tvayi kutas iva na sā
translated: In the state of liberation, devotion to you arises from where? Even for those with mortal characteristics, it does not exist.

original: rājati tato 'nurūpām āropaya siddhibhūmikām aja mām // / //
analyzed: rājati tatas nurūpām āropaya siddhi bhūmikām aja mām
translated: Therefore, O unborn one, place me on the stage of accomplishment, which is suitable.

original: siddhilavalābhalubdhaṃ mām avalepena mā vibho saṃsthāḥ
analyzed: siddhi lava lābha lubdham mām avalepena mā vibho saṃsthāḥ
translated: O Lord, do not stand with arrogance towards me, who am greedy for the gain of a little accomplishment.

original: kṣāmas tvadbhaktimukhe prollasadaṇimādipakṣato mokṣaḥ // / //
translated: I am emaciated, but liberation shines forth in the face of devotion to you, with the favor of lightness and other qualities.

original: dāsasya me prasīdatu bhagavān etāvad eva nanu yāce
analyzed: dāsasya me prasīdatu bhagavān etāvat eva nanu yāce
translated: May the Blessed One be pleased with me, your servant, who asks for this much alone.

original: dātā tribhuvananātho yasya na tanmādṛśāṃ dṛśo viṣayaḥ // / //
analyzed: dātā tribhuvana nāthaḥ yasya na tat mādṛśām dṛśaḥ viṣayaḥ
translated: The giver is the Lord of the three worlds, and that is not the object of sight for those like me.

original: tvadvapuḥsmṛtisudhārasapūrṇe mānase tava padāmbujayugmam
analyzed: tvad vapuḥ smṛti sudhā rasa pūrṇe mānase tava pada ambuja yugmam
translated: In the mind filled with the nectar of the remembrance of your form, may your pair of lotus feet

original: māmake vikasad astu sadaiva prasravanmadhu kim apy atilokam // / //
analyzed: māmake vikasat astu sadā eva prasravat madhu kim api ati lokam
translated: always bloom in me, oozing honey that is beyond the world.

original: asti me prabhur asau janako 'tha tryambako 'tha jananī ca bhavānī
analyzed: asti me prabhuḥ asau janakaḥ tha jananī ca bhavānī
translated: I have that Lord, the creator, and the three-eyed one, and also the mother, Bhavānī.

original: na dvitīya iha ko 'pi mamāstīty eva nirvṛtatamo vicareyam // / //
analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ iha kaḥ pi mama asti iti eva nirvṛtatamaḥ vicareyam
translated: I have no second here at all, thus being fully satisfied, I would wander.

original: carvanābhidhānam vimśam stotram
analyzed: carvanābhidhānam vimśam stotram
translated: The twenty-first hymn named The Chew

original: nathaṃ tribhuvananāthaṃ bhūtisitaṃ trinayanaṃ triśūladharam
analyzed: natham tribhuvana nātham bhūti sitam trinayanam triśūla dharam
translated: I praise the Lord, the Lord of the three worlds, who is white with ash, has three eyes, holds a trident,

original: upavītīkṛtabhoginam indukalāśekharaṃ vande // / //
analyzed: upavītīkṛta bhoginam indu kalā śekharam vande
translated: has serpents used as sacred thread, and has the crescent moon as a crest-jewel.

original: naumi nijatanuvinismaradaṃśukapariveṣadhavalaparidhānam
analyzed: naumi nija tanu vinismarat aṃśuka pariveṣa dhavala paridhānam
translated: I bow to the one whose outer garment is white with the radiance of the garment emerging from his own body,

original: vilasatkapālamālākalpitanṛttotsavākalpam // / //
analyzed: vilasat kapāla mālā kalpita nṛtta utsava ākalpam
translated: Who has made the dance festival with the shining garland of skulls.

original: vande tān daivataṃ yeṣāṃ haraś ceṣṭā harocitāḥ
analyzed: vande tān daivatam yeṣām haraḥ ca iṣṭāḥ hara ucitāḥ
translated: I praise those gods whose actions are worthy of Hara,

original: haraikapravaṇāḥ prāṇāḥ sadā saubhāgyasadmanām // / //
analyzed: hara eka pravaṇāḥ prāṇāḥ sadā saubhāgya sadmanām
translated: Whose life breaths are always devoted to Hara, the abode of good fortune.

original: krīḍitaṃ tava maheśvaratāyāḥ pṛṣṭhato 'nyad idam eva yathaitat
analyzed: krīḍitam tava maheśvara tāyāḥ pṛṣṭhatas idam eva yathā etat
translated: O Mahesvara, this is just like the other thing that is behind your greatness,

original: iṣṭamātraghaṭiteṣv avadāneṣv ātmanā param upāyam upaimi // / //🔽tvaddhāmni viśvavandye 'sminn iyati krīḍane sati
analyzed: iṣṭa mātra ghaṭiteṣu avadāneṣu ātmanā param upāyam upaimi  tvad dhāmni viśva vandye smin iyati krīḍane sati
translated: In the gifts that are accomplished by mere desire, I resort to the supreme means with myself.🔽In this abode of yours, which is to be worshipped by the universe, while this play is going on,

original: tava nātha kiyān bhūyānn ānandarasasambhavaḥ // / //
analyzed: tava nātha kiyān bhūyān ānanda rasa sambhavaḥ
translated: O Lord, how much greater is your bliss that arises from the essence of rasa.

original: kathaṃ sa subhago mā bhūdyo gauryā vallabho haraḥ
analyzed: katham sa subhagaḥ mā bhūt yaḥ gauryāḥ vallabhaḥ haraḥ
translated: How can that fortunate one be, who is the beloved of Gauri, Hara?

original: haro 'pi mā bhūd atha kiṃ gauryāḥ paramavallabhaḥ // / //
analyzed: mā bhūt atha kim gauryāḥ parama vallabhaḥ
translated: Then let Hara also not be, the supreme beloved of Gauri.

original: dhyānāmṛtamayaṃ yasya svātmamūlam anaśvaram
analyzed: dhyāna amṛta mayam yasya sva ātma mūlam anaśvaram
translated: Whose meditation is full of nectar, whose root is one's own self, which is imperishable,

original: saṃvillatās tathārūpās tasya kasyāpi sattaroḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃvid latāḥ tathārūpāḥ tasya kasya api sat taroḥ
translated: The vines of such a form belong to some tree.

original: bhaktikaṇḍūsam ullāsāvasare parameśvara
analyzed: bhakti kaṇḍūsam ullāsa avasare parameśvara
translated: O Supreme Lord, at the time of the blossoming of the itch of devotion,

original: mahānikaṣapāṣāṇasthūṇā pūjaiva jāyate // / //
analyzed: mahā nikaṣa pāṣāṇa sthūṇā pūjā eva jāyate
translated: The worship itself becomes the great testing stone pillar.

original: sadā srṣṭivinodāya sadā sthitisukhāsine
analyzed: sadā srṣṭi vinodāya sadā sthiti sukha āsine
translated: Always for the enjoyment of creation, always seated in the bliss of sustenance,

original: sadā tribhuvanāhāratṛptāya svāmine namaḥ // / //
analyzed: sadā tribhuvana āhāra tṛptāya svāmine namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the Lord who is always satisfied by consuming the three worlds.

original: na kvāpi gatvā hitvāpi na kiṃcid idam eva ye
analyzed: na kvāpi gatvā hitvā api na kiṃcid idam eva ye
translated: Those who, having gone nowhere and left nothing,

original: bhavyaṃ tvaddhāma paśyanti bhavyās tebhyo namo namaḥ // / //
analyzed: bhavyam tvad dhāma paśyanti bhavyāḥ tebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: see your auspicious abode, to those auspicious ones, salutations again and again.

original: bhaktilakṣmīsamṛddhānāṃ kim anyad upayācitam
analyzed: bhakti lakṣmī samṛddhānām kim anyat upayācitam
translated: For those rich with the prosperity of devotion, what else is to be requested?

original: etayā vā daridraṇāṃ kim anyad upayācitam // / //
analyzed: etayā vā daridraṇām kim anyat upayācitam
translated: By this, what else is to be requested for the poor?

original: duḥkhāny api sukhāyante viṣam apy amṛtāyate
analyzed: duḥkhāni api sukhāyante viṣam api amṛtāyate
translated: Even sorrows become blissful, even poison becomes nectar,

original: mokṣāyate ca saṃsāro yatra mārgaḥ sa śaṅkaraḥ // / //
analyzed: mokṣāyate ca saṃsāraḥ yatra mārgaḥ sa śaṅkaraḥ
translated: and even the cycle of birth and death becomes liberation, where that path is auspicious.

original: mūle madhye 'vasāne ca nāsti duḥkhaṃ bhavajjuṣāṃ
analyzed: mūle madhye vasāne ca nā asti duḥkham bhavat juṣām
translated: For those who experience worldly existence, there is no suffering at the beginning, in the middle, or at the end.

original: tathāpi vayam īśāna sīdāmaḥ katham ucyatām // / //
analyzed: tathā api vayam īśāna sīdāmaḥ katham ucyatām
translated: Still, O Lord, we are sinking. How can it be said?

original: jñānayogādinānyeṣām apy apekṣitum arhati
analyzed: jñāna yoga ādinā anyeṣām api apekṣitum arhati
translated: You deserve to be requested by others through the path of knowledge, yoga, and so on,

original: prakāśaḥ svairiṇām iva bhavān bhaktimatāṃ prabho // / //
analyzed: prakāśaḥ svairiṇām iva bhavān bhaktimatām prabho
translated: just as light belongs to the independent ones, O Lord, to those devoted to you.

original: bhaktānāṃ nārtayo nāpy asty ādhyānaṃ svātmanas tava
analyzed: bhaktānām nā ārtayaḥ nā api asti ādhyānam sva ātmanaḥ tava
translated: For the devotees, there are no afflictions, no meditation on your own self,

original: tathāpy asti śivety etat kim apy eṣāṃ bahirmukhe // / //
analyzed: tathā api asti śivā iti etat kim api eṣām bahirmukhe
translated: still, there is something called Shiva for them, who are outwardly directed.

original: sarvābhāsāvabhāso yo vimarśavalito 'khilam
analyzed: sarva ābhāsa avabhāsaḥ yaḥ vimarśa valitaḥ khilam
translated: He who is the manifestation of all appearances, embraced by reflective awareness, the all,

original: aham etad iti staumi tāṃ kriyāśaktim īśa te // / //
analyzed: aham etat iti staumi tām kriyāśaktim īśa te
translated: I praise that power of action of yours, O Lord, thinking This is mine.

original: vartante jantavo 'śeṣā api brahmendraviṣṇavaḥ
analyzed: vartante śeṣāḥ api brahma indra viṣṇavaḥ
translated: All beings, even Brahma, Indra, and Vishnu,

original: grasamānās tato vande deva viśvaṃ bhavanmayam // / //
analyzed: grasamānāḥ tatas vande deva viśvam bhavat mayam
translated: are swallowed up by it. Therefore, I bow to you, O God, the universe is full of you.

original: sato vināśasambandhān matparaṃ nikhilaṃ mṛṣā
analyzed: sataḥ vināśa sambandhāt mad param nikhilam mṛṣā
translated: Everything except you is false, having the connection of destruction with existence.

original: evamevodyate nātha tvayā saṃhāralīlayā // / //
analyzed: evam evā udyate nātha tvayā saṃhāra līlayā
translated: In the same way, O Lord, you are raised up by your playful act of dissolution.

original: dhyātam ātmupatiṣṭhata eva tvadvapur varada bhaktidhanānām
analyzed: dhyātam ātmā upatiṣṭhate eva tvad vapuḥ vara da bhakti dhanānām
translated: O Giver of boons, the bodies of those rich in devotion to you remain contemplated even in the soul.

original: apy acintyam akhilādbhutacintākartṛtāṃ prati ca te vijayante // / //
analyzed: api acintyam akhila adbhuta cintā kartṛ tām prati ca te vijayante
translated: They are victorious in their ability to perform unthinkable and marvelous thoughts, which are all of you.

original: tāvakabhaktirasāsavasekād iva sukhitamarmamaṇḍalasphuritaiḥ
analyzed: tāvaka bhakti rasa āsava sekāt iva sukhita marma maṇḍala sphuritaiḥ
translated: As if sprinkled with the nectar of the essence of devotion to you,

original: nṛtyati vīrajano niśi vetālakulaiḥ kṛtotsāhaḥ // / //
analyzed: nṛtyati vīra janaḥ niśi vetāla kulaiḥ kṛta utsāhaḥ
translated: the heroic people dance at night with the joyful Vetala clans.

original: ārabdhā bhavadabhinutir amunā yenāṅgakena mama śambho
analyzed: ārabdhā bhavat abhinutiḥ amunā yena aṅgakena mama śambho
translated: O Shambhu, by this limb of mine, which has begun to praise you,

original: tenāparyantam imaṃ kālaṃ dṛḍham akhilam eva bhaviṣīṣṭa // / //
analyzed: tena aparyantam imam kālam dṛḍham akhilam eva bhaviṣīṣṭa
translated: may it remain firm and complete for this endless time.
